Time to end the import everything model. We need to offer more good job opportunities to all those settled here, and buy more home produced goods and services.

The PM today should tell us how levelling up is about helping people on their personal journey to home ownership, to their own business, or to a better paid job. It’s about great education and training, and more opportunity.
Great agenda from the farmers to increase the amount of home produced food. Plenty of opportunities the government should back.
See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5 for background to the Health review announced by the Secretary of State.

When the PM had a good answer to a question the BBC Today programme tried to stop him, asking a different question. BBC interviewers should allow an answer and pretend to be interested in the person they are interviewing. They seem to want to impose their view instead.

I wish the General well who has been appointed as Wastefinder to the NHS. While we await his report the government should work with NHS Chief Executives to get them to get rid of the waste they think is there. Start with the costs of Test and Trace.

Lord Frost shows signs of impatience with EU over Northern Ireland. He should just take back control of GB to NI trade. Stop  EU interference and diversion of our internal trade, which is against the clear statement in the Protocol.
Glad we are all low tax Conservatives. When do we see the tax cuts to provide some stimulus for work and enterprise?
Government should abandon the increase in National Insurance. A further tax on jobs will slow the economy when we need to go for growth and higher take home pay.
There needs to be more effort on energy policy to cut our import dependence for electricity and gas. We need more energy reserves to keep the lights on and the economy moving.

Ministers should announce a new growth target as the core of economic policy alongside the inflation target. That is the way to get the deficit down, with tax cuts to make work and self employment more rewarding.
Sad news that COVID deaths now exceed 700,000 in the USA. The media that highlight this never mentioned EU deaths now at 768,000 when they went through that number. Why the different treatment?
China’s emission targets are not working. China will now buy up more fossil fuel to put the  lights back on.
China’s electricity cuts are a warning to government. Make sure you have enough generating capacity that works when the wind does not blow and when some fuels are scarce.

Right to wind up the furlough scheme and get people back to work. We need more people to come forward for the large number of vacancies if some are unfortunate to find their old job cannot be sustained.
More bad car production figures. No mention of the high new car taxes and the campaigns to stop people buying new diesel and petrol cars. It’s not just a microprocessor shortage.

The UK was wrong to give the EU more transitional fishing rights and has been very generous in allowing so many vessels into our waters. The EU does not reciprocate when we are generous but instead makes nasty threats.
We voted to take control of our fish. We need to reduce the amount of fishing in total to restore the fishery and give priority to UK vessels. We should ban the ultra large  industrial vessels.

The German SPD leader is wrong to blame Brexit for a shortage of HGV drivers that affects the  continent as well as the UK. Trying to form  a government with under 26% of the vote  should be problem enough for him. The UK is right to want better pay and conditions for drivers.
On line companies have attracted lots of extra drivers to do parcel van deliveries. HGV employers need to learn from them how they did it.
Government needs to speed up expanded testing and training for drivers. Lowering taxes on work instead of increasing them would help. Make driving pay well.

At last the government sees we need more electricity generation. Small nuclear plants a good idea when available from 2030. There is still a big gap to fill this decade as old nuclear retires. Biomass and gas much needed.

Glad the government wants to attract people with HGV licences back to driving. Cancelling IR35 is needed. Pity about the new NI tax on jobs. We need a concerted policy to improve take home pay and conditions.
BP’s announcement of delivery difficulties at a few petrol stations got people rushing to buy fuel to stockpile. Not helpful.

Inviting in cheap Labour from the EU will not solve the shortage of drivers. I am glad the government is appealing  to anyone with a licence to  return. It needs to work with business on better terms and pay so we have more volunteers. It also needs a big step up  in  tests.

Big companies short of lorry drivers can help ease the  shortage by training more, offering bonuses to people already qualified to come back, and improving pay and conditions. Drivers are essential workers and should be offered attractive packages.
The government needs to think bigger and faster about electrical capacity. We are already short with more demand ahead. Current reliance on imports leaves us vulnerable.

Good to hear government is planning another nuclear power plant. We need to replace the older ones soon to close. We will also need extra capacity as people switch more to electricity so let’s hear  how they will expand the total.

Whilst we await a bigger switch away from fossil fuels we need enough gas and oil to keep the lights on and prices affordable. The UK should encourage more home production to ease transition to a more electric future.

Either bill payers or taxpayers are going to have to pay a lot more for gas. The government should allow the industry to produce more from the North Sea by granting more permits to ease future shortages.

The EU complains the UK is forging a stronger alliance with Australia. They come across as bad losers who failed to lock us in to the EU and cannot understand they no longer control us. As an independent country the  UK will ally and trade more with friendly partners.

We need to keep more back up generating capacity for when there’s no  wind. We need more oil and gas from the North Sea all the time we have gas heating and fossil fuel transport. We cannot run everything on reliable renewable electricity with current homes and transport.
Price controls do not work. Energy bills will go up despite them. Taxpayers will have to help bail out companies damaged by them.
The next meeting of the National Security Council should plan for less reliance on imported energy and food. National resilience requires more self sufficiency in the basics as well as in technology.

The gas shortage needs action. What about creating more gas storage? Why not encourage more home gas supply to replace unreliable imports? UK governments have been too ready to make us import dependent which leaves us vulnerable to price hikes and shortages.

The Business Secretary says the answer to our energy shortage is more renewable electricity. The main problem is a lack of wind so more windmills will not fix it. We need more reliable power so it has to be hydro, biomass, nuclear.
As France is  leading EU discussions on EU military forces without the USA and UK why is she so upset if we make our own arrangements? One rule for France and a different one for everyone else?
The Business Secretary should put security of supply at the top of his energy policy. We are now short of gas and electricity  and are far too reliant on imports. Action please.
Time for the Treasury to abandon the austerity Maastricht rules.We need a new policy framework based on low inflation and faster growth targets.
China wants COP 26 to be FLOP 26. The world’s largest generator of CO 2 by far intends to carry on increasing its output for the next few years so it can undercut us in world markets.

I welcome the UK, USA and Australia agreement to strengthen the defences of freedom and free trade. Why  does the EU have to complain about everything an independent UK does, like bad losers? And why does the BBC think the negative EU response is the big story here?
Today I call on the Business Secretary to ensure we increase our electricity capacity. See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5.

The loss of the French inter connector for electricity reinforces my longstanding argument that we should not rely on imports. We need national resilience based on our own reliable generating capacity.
The first duty of energy policy is to keep the lights on. The shortage of wind and the loss of imports is a strong warning that we need to put in more reliable generating  capacity at home.
Two thirds of our electricity this morning coming from fossil fuels. We are going to need a lot more functioning renewable power for the electric revolution.
Farmers are right to want a stronger grow British food policy. It makes sense to cut imports and food miles.

The protesters on the M25 tried to stop food getting to shops and medicines getting to patients. They were demanding the government helps insulate more homes which it is already doing. If they want a change of policy they should stand for election, not disrupt everyone else.
I see the National Insurance rise has united the TUC and CBI against it. The government should reconsider.
The Prime Minister needs to sweep away those COVID rules that do not work or cannot be properly enforced. People can make more of their own decisions about social distancing and infection risk.

If the government wants to call a tax after what it pays for, it should understand how huge the health budget is. We should call all Income tax, all Capital Gains, all Inheritance Tax and Stamp duty the Health taxes as all of them are needed to pay this year’s  health budget
Good to hear the government is not proposing vaccine passports. Many Conservative MPs were getting ready to vote against. This week’s statement in the Commons told Ministers how unpopular they are.

Next week we debate the detail of the social care tax. I will want to know how we will improve the quality and volume of care this year and next, and how we will recruit, train and reward more care workers.
Fantastic tennis from Emma Raducanu. She shows the more you practice the more your dreams can come true. Her  spirit, hard work and skill are a lesson for us all.

I want  Ministers to supply more detail next week on how extra money for the NHS could deliver falls in waiting lists and then better social care. I hope they will also spell out how all the existing budgets are being spent as the new money is less than 5% of current  spend.

How will the NHS ensure the new ICS Boards and ICS partnerships, sitting on top of the NHS Trusts, will not add to the costs of bureaucracy? When the urgent issue is cutting waiting lists how helpful is this large management reorganisation?

UK economy already slowing too much before tax rises hit. The government needs to go for growth, support enterprise and then see the deficit tumble. The Treasury needs a pro growth policy, not threats of more tax rises and spending cuts.

How much of the extra spending on health compared to 2019 went on one off set up costs for test and trace and other anti COVID measures? Can‘t some of this cash now be used to tackle waiting  lists? Health spend this year has £64 bn more than 2 years ago.

Yesterday I asked the government what reduction in waiting  lists would we get for the extra  tax money for the NHS? They said they could make no promises on reducing waits so I voted against the tax. The current NHS budget is more than the total income tax revenue.
The NHS budget for 2019 prior to COVID was £166bn. This year the budget is £230 bn. The £64bn increase did not need a tax rise. What level of cut in waiting lists will we get from another £11 bn?
If all the new tax money goes to the NHS what will be done about social care budgets?
Time to tackle waste in government. Why are we paying for so much office accommodation which the civil service has no plan to use again?
If the Taliban did want to run a normal government they would open the airport and allow people with the right documents to leave.

The Treasury should not be demanding any tax rises on the back of wildly pessimistic forecasts of the deficit. It overstated it by a massive £90 bn for last year and this year it is already £26 bn below its forecast.

If an elderly person goes to live permanently in a care home it often makes sense for them to sell their former home. Otherwise it  would cost them money to pay the tax on it whilst unoccupied and in need of maintenance.
We are short of vets because of the EU misuse  of the NI Protocol. Let’s take control of our own internal trade and free the vets to look after sick animals.

Lord Frost should tell the EU there will be no more EU checks on goods passing from GB to NI for NI use. This is internal trade which we will supervise. No need to invoke legal process, just enforce the EU’s statement they will respect our internal market.
Congratulations to all our medal winners in Tokyo.  A great result.

The government should say our tax rates are high enough. We would raise more tax if some rates were cut. Better  social care  is a priority we can afford without singling it out to require a tax rise. It seems we can afford lots of government spending people  rate  less  highly.
Those who promote electric cars need to be honest about how government  will  replace lost  taxes on petrol and diesel cars.

Breaking election promises of no increases in National Insurance or Income Tax a bad idea. Offer an insurance scheme for elderly care costs which people can opt into if they are keen to protect the inheritance money.
Poland short of lorry drivers. The USA turning to 14 year olds to fill jobs in hospitality. Those ’Brexit’ problems popping up in lots of different countries!

We are short of homes, NHS  appointments and other services. The government  needs to limit the numbers of migrants to those most deserving our help to make sure we can offer good standards to those we welcome.
Now the main Afghan rescue mission is over government needs to turn its attention to strengthening our borders and reinforcing a job rich economic recovery at home.
What is right about bidding qualified people out of lower income countries instead of training and rewarding the talent of people who live in the UK?

Much better to pay more and train more people here in the UK to fill vacancies. Bringing in people from abroad to keep wages down is cheap for the employer but a high cost to the taxpayer with a need to build more homes and provide more school places and NHS capacity.
Good news that UK troops and diplomats are now out of Kabul. The new task is to secure our borders, and build diplomatic alliances with those with influence against any renewed terrorism.

Merkel’s CDU party with the CSU has slumped to 21% in the latest poll for the German General election, just behind the SPD. Voters  are telling pollsters they do not like the 3 main Chancellor candidates or their parties much.
How many people does President Biden need  to attack  in his new Afghan war before pulling out of that?
When is the UK going to tell the EU they cannot interfere with UK companies trading goods between GB and Northern  Ireland? Time to take back control.

President Biden’s premature and over hasty exit from Afghanistan has left more people at risk and has damaged the reputation of NATO. We need to assure the world we will not do the same again in other places where we offer military support and advice to friendly  governments.
President Biden says he will end the US  Afghan war on 31 August. He now says he will hunt down the bombers at the airport. Which is it?
Business can solve the driver shortage by raising wages and improving working conditions. Just recruit and train some more.

The UK car industry blames the pingdemic and microprocessor shortage for a further big loss of output. The relentless attacks on new diesel and petrol cars, and the wish of some Councils to stop people using them is also threatening factory jobs here at home.

Why can’t France arrest the people traffickers who take thousands of pounds from migrants to put them at risk in small boats? These criminals buy and organise the boats and take the money on French territory.

Occupying London streets to stop people getting to work or earning a living  will not save the planet. Why not take the protests to countries that are increasing their CO2 output and their use of coal?
If the US  suddenly pull out of Kabul airport we may need to carry on until all UK citizens have been helped. The UK needs to plan and manage risks accordingly.
Global Britain means having our own policy and recruiting allies for each mission or cause. The UK establishment should not seek to do what the USA or EU  presses us to do unless it is right for us.

Why do the left want to invite everyone with a poor life in  the  world to the UK whilst being very critical of our country? Why do they not demand other countries  help more or put  right what they are doing wrong?
Greta Thunberg should withdraw her false accusations about the UK. She should concentrate on China which produces 27 times the amount of CO 2 the UK does.

Plenty of comments today that whilst we should rescue all UK citizens and those who have worked for the UK from Afghanistan we need to raise our guard against future terrorist threats and improve our border controls.

Strong criticism of China and Germany for not ending the use of coal in the way the UK has during questions by the audience after my speech yesterday. Feeling they are going slow on net zero to get a competitive edge.
The world needs to use sanctions and money flow to push a new Afghan government to good behaviour. The aim must be to prevent violence and terror so people do not need to flee the country.

The UK should lead the G7 to tell the Taliban that it is not in their or our interest for a mass exodus of refugees. We must use  control of IMF money, aid, sanctions on trade and bank accounts to encourage the formation of an Afghan  government Afghans can live with.

The IMF is right not to send money to Afghanistan before they know who is running the government and what their plans are. The world should not fund  terrorism or an illegal regime that shoots its own people.

President Biden says he knew his decision to pull out of Afghanistan suddenly would cause chaos so why did he do it? And why does he now say US troops could stay a little longer to have a little less chaos?
The urgent priority is a clear government plan to keep the UK safe from any possible resurgence of terrorism aided by the Taliban.

The UK is right to try to create a united  G7  response to the Taliban. The West needs to talk to Pakistan who will be seeking to gain  but who will not want Afghanistan to   return  to  being  a  school  for  indiscriminate terrorism or a source of border instability  for  them.

Many Opposition proposals for the UK to take more refugees but they offer  no good ideas on how the international community can get the Taliban to honour their promises on freedoms and economic progress. We need ways to avoid another mass exodus from a  middle  Eastern  country.
The UK government needs a security plan to deal with a Taliban Afghan government. We need to secure our borders against any terrorists and illegal trade the new Afghanistan might shelter or assist.

President Biden decided to pull his forces out without proper discussion and  agreement with allies. Why? When will he offer some world leadership on what next for peace and democracy in the Middle East.
I am pleased Parliament is recalled to discuss Afghanistan this week. We should also be discussing illegal immigration, economic recovery and COVID policy.

I went to two events recently. No one scanned the NHS vaccination details I had printed out. Both had problems with their digital ticket scanners which meant slower progress than relying on normal  tickets.

Today I ask the NHS why do they want us to download a scan code to prove vaccination when we all have an excellent card with all the details on? Why can’t we check what the code says? Why does the promised one month validity become only two days on some computer print outs?
The UK should send the  USA some urgent advice on how to limit the damage of President Biden’s unilateral decision to leave Afghanistan without supporting the Afghan government properly.
Why couldn’t Westminster Council find a local designer for its expensive mound? There was no need to create jobs in the Netherlands. Maybe a local would have had more feel for the setting.
Unwelcome confirmation of people catching CV 19 in hospital last year. I repeat my long running questions on isolation hospitals,  infection control, air extraction  and anti viral cleaning.

The US decision to pull out of Afghanistan too quickly without the engagement and willing support of the Afghan government and allies has been a disaster. 20 years of NATO military sacrifice and expense ends with a Taliban take over and our civilians having  to flee in fear.

President Biden first encouraged immigrants condemning Trump’s policy then turned against illegals via Mexico. Last month he expelled record numbers without considering asylum cases. Why no condemnation by Lib Dems/Labour who criticise legal UK moves to tackle illegal migration?

When will the Treasury announce a new framework for our economy and cancel the old state debt and deficit Maastricht rules? Let‘s keep the 2% inflation and debt interest controls and add a growth target.   We need a faster recovery not Maastricht austerity.
More are agreeing that the green revolution needs heating systems and vehicles people want to buy and can afford.

Well done to many successful A level students. Some  ask about the big increase in top grades.  The question examiners have to answer is how do you ensure fairness between years and  schools? Future switching from grade letters to numbers would not resolve this issue.

Poor new car sales are not just down to supply shortages. People do not want to pay the  high Vehicle Excise duty on some new cars. They are put off new diesel and petrol vehicles by the relentless campaigns  against  them.

The green revolution of heat pumps, electric vehicles and  vegetarian diets can only go at the pace people are willing to accept. Governments need to persuade, not to try to tax and regulate people to do things they do not want to do or cannot afford.

On BBC Radio 4 today finally allowed to say the COP 26 Climate Conference must challenge China to start cutting her huge output of CO 2 and Germany to close her coal power stations as the UK has done. Time to level  the competition over fuel choice and cost.
Well done Team GB at the Olympics. It’s  been great to have so much good news and to see happy people. They show if you work very hard you might excel. They deserve their rewards and our support.

The two countries Alok Sharma should target in his push for net zero are China and Germany. Others will be reluctant to impose more costs and disruption on their economies all the time China and Germany get rich by burning more coal.
Why should UK people be told to fit expensive heat pumps they don’t want and can’t afford when China and Germany keep on burning coal on an industrial scale to dominate export markets?

The COP 26 Climate conference needs to secure a Chinese pledge to start reducing their output of carbon dioxide. The world’s biggest producer of the gas swamps smaller countries attempts to cut it, whilst giving China an advantage in making things to export to the rest of us.
Why does the BBC ignore England? Why does it want to break it up into regions just as the EU did?

England does not see London as a problem.  The   C of E is  wrong  on  that.  It does see the negative attitude of the BBC and some  other UK institutions to England as unfair. They   boost Scottishness and ignore English feelings. Why no BBC England to match BBC Scotland?

Glad the Church of England now recognises England. Pity they did not say that when the EU was breaking  England up by imposing  artificial and unpopular regions on us and refusing to even allow England on its maps.
Will the Borders Minister update us on progress in detecting and prosecuting criminals organising and profiting from dangerous small boat journeys?

The promoters of smart meters told me that under half of electricity customers have wanted one so far despite a seven year campaign. They said they do want them used in the future by the industry to vary tariffs depending on time of day and availability of wind and solar power.

I would like to see some of the Olympic events after work in the evening. Instead  the BBC offers me a long programme talking about some athletes and their problems or joys  interspersed by short clips from events I am not allowed to see for myself.

I see the PM’s Climate Change advocate shares the view that diesel cars are better than battery vehicles for long trips. So why the early date to end new diesel car manufacture?  More  people will follow her example and keep their old diesels.

The BBC invited me onto Newsnight last night. They told me they were interested in my views and did not want to fit me into a script. I agreed. They then told me what I had to talk about which was something I had not expressed a view on!    Why do that? I declined.

Well done to all our Olympic athletes. It is great to see the media full of stories of people who are living their dream and achieving success. They remind all of us that you can    work hard and bring happiness into your life. GB is proud of them.

The UK government needs to back UK jobs by buying more of  things it needs from good value  home  sources. The government should  allow for the extra tax revenue and lower  benefit cost for things not imported. The French and Germans back their home producers.
Expert fears of increasing CV cases after end of lockdown were wrong. Time to rethink the strategy and to rely on the vaccines, so people can can get their freedoms back.
Time for a new travel plan. The travel industry needs greater certainty about what the rules are going to be. Let the vaccines do more of the work of controlling the virus.

The newly nationalised railway is running up huge losses for taxpayers to fund. They need a plan for new timetables that offer services people want to use that reflects new working patterns. See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5 for the details.

Sad news of COVID infections caught in hospital. I have asked the new Health Secretary to do more to improve infection controls in health settings, with better air flow and extraction systems and anti viral cleaning methods.
Today on https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5 I ask why so many official forecasts and figures are wrong. Bad data can produce bad policy.
BBC coverage of the Olympics is poor. Too much punditry and banal discussion, too little film of  athletes competing. Perhaps they have borrowed the style from the way they treat politics.

I see many are still blaming the poor UK new car sales on a shortage of microchips. Why no comment on the collapse in diesel car output where the UK was strong? That’s down to a continuous campaign to ban new diesels which will close factories.
If the government now wants to see more tourists and travel it needs to allow more people to go to work. There are still too many well people told to self isolate.

Can we now return to Ministers appearing on the media and at press conferences, drawing on the work of both Health and Treasury civil servants who do not give interviews? Ministers need to balance the two and take responsibility for whatever advice they use.
The PM ‘s attack on crime should start with maximum focus and resource to arrest and charge the people traffickers making a fortune out of risking lives at sea.
Falling COVID case numbers allows UK to cancel the pingdemic by changing the system. The forecast strong economic recovery needs people who are not ill to be able to go to work.

The Home Secretary has urged more efforts to detect, deter and prosecute the people traffickers making a fortune out of risking people’s lives in dangerous small boats in the Channel. Surely the state can use its powers to break these criminal rings?

The welcome sharp falls in COVID cases ever since “Freedom day “ is not what government experts predicted when they urged caution.  Time for stronger countervailing experts worried about non COVID health problems and the economy?
Great to see falls in CV 19 cases. So far unaffected by relaxation of rules.

The government is worried foreign  investors are keen to buy great UK companies especially in technology. The government needs to do more to buy UK goods and cut its spending  abroad. All the time we import too much we have to sell assets to cover the trade deficit.

Is all the money being spent on smart meters a good idea, when so many people do not want one? This very expensive “free” programme needs to change.  The companies need to ask why so many  are against.
Why do electric car ads fail to talk  about car prices, range, battery life, recharge times and charger  availability? Do they set out to annoy us by missing out the key issues?
Good to see CV 19 case numbers falling whilst some steps are being taken to relax. Government needs to do more to let people who are well get back to work by reviewing self isolation guidance.
The government needs urgently to assert some common sense so people who are well can get to work. The pingdemic is doing needless harm to our shops and deliveries.

Today’s UK state borrowing figures show official borrowing forecasts for this year remain too gloomy. Another downward revision for last year where they greatly exaggerated borrowing in all their forecasts.
Today I  urge the government to take back control of GB to Northern Ireland trade. Glad David Frost is preparing to take unilateral  action if EU continues to block sensible agreement.
A good economic recovery needs more people to be spared self isolation when they are well, and no threats of more taxes.
Will the government use freedom day to adapt its self isolation guidance to something more sensible and less damaging to the economy?
Glad the supermarkets are speaking out about the damage the EU is doing to food supplies from GB to Northern Ireland. The government must take control and restore the flow of goods.
When will the government revise its NHS CV 19 app so more people use it without it triggering so many demands to self isolate by people are not infected?

On Thursday Parliament unanimously passed a motion to sort out the Irish border issues and reject the EU’s unreasonable manipulation of the Northern Ireland Protocol. This did not get much media attention despite the government promising early action.
When is the government going to curb its pindemic? This is doing too much damage to jobs and incomes.

All the time so many people are asked to self isolate there will be more damage to jobs and incomes. The Bank of England needs to keep money policy supportive as long as CV 19 disruption to the economy continues.
Today in Parliament MPs will urge the government to take control of GB / Northern Ireland trade and restore the UK internal market. The EU’s efforts to damage this trade have gone too far.

The government wants us to buy electric cars. They need to be cheaper, have a longer range and be easier to recharge. Will the government rule out any new tax on using them as they seek to reduce tax paying  petrol and diesel cars?
It is time to end furlough. There are shortages of people for jobs in lots of areas so we need to get everyone back to work now.
The government tomorrow needs to tell us who speaks for England in the cabinet.

I see friends of the OBR/Treasury have been briefing gloom about debts again. The way to remove the deficit is to build confidence and go for a full throttle recovery. No return to Maastricht austerity rules.
Can we have a day off from gloomy COVID experts finding new things to worry about so we can enjoy what could be a great day?
Who speaks for England in the government? Why propose the end of English devolution the very week-end the government waves the English flag for the football?

The government should not be taking away England’s limited right to veto laws we do not like. Labour’s devolution was lop sided, unfair  and has damaged the Union. Giving Scotland more powers strengthened the SNP who want to end the Union.
Glad to read the PM does not want to drive up heating bills. To get popular buy in for the green agenda it has to be good for consumers.
Brilliant England win. Great for the UK. Great for the most ignored and understated country in our Union. Even the BBC has to mention England today.
The abrupt departure of US troops from Afghanistan has shown how important they with allies have  been to law and order there.
Why the delay in changing the self isolation rules? How many healthy people do they want stuck at home and not working?
So after threats Germany now says Uk vaccinated travellers can visit. Why would many want to holiday there after all their attempts to block our decision to be a friendly independent country?
The self isolation guidance needs changing. Too many people without CV19 are being asked to self isolate, harming schools and business.

The BBC back today telling us the sad news the US has suffered the most deaths from CV19 at over 600,000. No mention again of the 738,000 in the EU, or of the higher death rates of countries like Hungary and Czechia. Why don’t they report the EU news on this topic?

All these Test and trace requirements to self isolate are damaging people’s livelihoods and getting  in the way of recovery. Let’s have some  common sense and personal judgment now the vaccines are working so well for most people.
The government seems to be rediscovering freedom to allow us to run our own lives again. Why wait another two weeks? It is well past the time to unlock.
Skill, passion, enterprise, game awareness, confidence without complacency, that was a prefect performance by England. A pleasure to watch. More of that can win the title.

The government should change its advice on CV 19 contacts and isolation. They are asking far too many people to self isolate when vaccination greatly cuts the risks of serious illness or spreading infection.

The PM today should tell Mrs Merkel the UK is fed up with the EU’s one sided interpretations of the Withdrawal Agreement which says it respects our internal market. The UK must take control of our Northern Ireland trade and fish if the EU continues  to  be  awkward.

Mrs Merkel does  not want UK people going on holiday in the EU, so go somewhere else. Now I hear they are creating legal difficulties over people vaccinated with the Astra jabs. Why when they were complaining they could not get  enough  of  it?
It would be a good idea for the government to time any future ban of new diesel and petrol cars for a date when it is clear everyone wants to buy electric  cars and we can make enough of them here.

The Nissan announcement shows Brexit was no threat to the UK car industry. The whole industry here and in the EU does face a serious challenge from the forthcoming ban on new petroleum and diesel cars.

The UK does not need a delay in EU bans on GB trade with Northern Ireland : we need to take full control of GB to Northern Ireland  trade so there is no EU threat to it. The EU agreed the UK internal market matters and we make the rules for it.

When Mrs Merkel comes for talks on Friday the UK must tell her the EU’s nasty approach on everything from Northern Ireland to vaccines is hitting  them. It is putting Uk consumers off all those imports we used to buy. There has been a big reduction in  the  UK trade  deficit.
Brilliant result last night by England in  the Euros. Shows how important Sterling is to success.
The Health Secretary is right to look for a new policy to send fewer pupils home from school over CV 19.

The media tell me the new Health Secretary wants an early relaxation of controls. Good news. They also tell me he is a lockdown sceptic. Strange then that he did not vote against the measures when MPs had the chance to do so.
My letter to the new Health Secretary asks him to expedite drug trials to widen treatments of  CV 19 and to look at improved air extraction and UV cleaning to help control infection.
The BBC was sent secret documents about national security. Why did they think they should read them and publish important parts of them? Shouldn't they have just sent them back to the government?
When France and the EU spend so much time trying to harm our trade why do they think we would want to subsidise their channel tunnel trains?

Now  UK Opposition parties  in line with the EU are lecturing people to go by bicycle, to get rid of fossil fuel  cars, to take out the gas boiler and eat less meat, shouldn't their advocates on the media be asked if they have first done that themselves?

The big three  CO 2 producers, China, the EU and the USA account  for over half the world CO  2 . The UK is  just 1%. At COP 26 the world must ask China to start reining in and tell Germany to cut out all the coal power stations as we have already done. Otherwise, it’s not fair.

The EU has said it is working hard to resolve Northern Ireland trade problems. No need to work hard. Just remove all the wrecking rules they are trying to impose to stop the GB to NI food and medicine supply.

The question to ask all those Remain MPs is are they proud to have delayed our Brexit so long? Was it a good plan to undermine the UK in negotiations and try to thwart the result of the UK’s biggest ever democratic vote? Why did they trust the EU more than U.K. voters?
BBC World service used the five year anniversary of the Brexit vote to repeat the main Remain issues.Did not mention any of the positive gains and ignored the great themes of the Leave campaign.
Yesterday I spoke in the Commons about how we can get on top of the housing shortage and keep farms, woods and green gaps. See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5
Another good drop in new government borrowing last month despite pandemic controls . Promoting recovery and unlocking is the way to cut the deficit. Official forecasts are still too pessimistic.

The EU attack on U.K. tv programmes shows continuing contempt for the  Free Trade Agreement and their own Treaty rules about relations with neighbours. The U.K. needs to push back hard, especially on the EU attempts to stifle GB/NI trade.
DEFRA seems to want to turn the whole of the U.K. into a wild area. It needs to get behind more home  food and timber production and encourage more successful productive farms.

England is falling behind on promises of tree planting. The government needs to back trees for sustainable timber to harness private investment to hit its targets. Why is DEFRA so against home production of wood?
If Labour were  to  seek a deal with Greens, Lib Dems  and even  with SNP for a left wing alliance it means they cease to be a national party fighting every seat to try to win a U.K. majority.

The government’s green policy should begin with looking after our green fields and farms by going for a sustainable immigration policy. People we welcome here need a good home. There are limits to how many houses we can build.
The government is considering changes it can make to our rules now we are out of the EU. See https://t.co/GYlcjC4b9B  for the many opportunities to improve  our lives and have a more prosperous U.K.

The voters of Chesham made clear their dislike of too much building. All the time we invite an extra 300,000 people a year to live here we need to build lots of houses to provide decent homes.The government should seek a sustainable rate of economic migration.
HS2 and possible new planning  rules lost Conservatives a seat yesterday. Conservative voters think being green means not building over beautiful places.
Lots of doubts about the data and the presentation by government scientists to secure the continued lockdown. Ministers should use an early look at new data to bring forward Freedom Day.

GB News gave a good answer to woke advertisers tonight. Glad to see it building an audience for the decent news and viewpoints that are banned or belittled by the BBC and C4.  We need to find an alternative to the narrow negative intolerant establishment media.
Yesterday I urged the government to trust people more and to control people less. Only 60 of us voted for freedom. The Opposition backed the government and mainly stayed away from the debate.
The Fed, the US Central Bank, yesterday owned up to some of the extra US  inflation that’s coming. They still didn’t accept they are helping cause it.
Great interview on GB News asking Chancellor who will pay for heat pumps and electric vehicles.

The five representatives of the EU failed to hijack the G7 to intensify  their disruption of the U.K. internal market. What’s their next trick going to be as they seek to alienate the majority community in Northern Ireland more?

GB News is so much better than  the BBC. Interviewees are allowed to say what they want  without constant interruption and without an interviewer telling them what they really think.  They do not have to fit into the limited  and warped BBC script.
I buy much of my food from U.K. farms. I do not buy  EU food given their unpleasant attempts to punish us. Happy to have more choice from Australia.
Good news that Australia wants to expand trade with the U.K. on a fair and friendly basis. What a contrast with the EU that does everything it can to block trade and pick trade fights with us.
The G7 reaffirmed the need to end all coal burning to generate power. When is Germany going to comply?

The EU used its over representation at the G7 to disagree with  President Biden’s China policy and water it down. It toughened its assault on Northern Ireland. Pity it couldn’t find more to agree about with its major allies.
The U.K. must now carry out the PM’s threat to allow free movement of goods from GB to NI. It’s the promise NI wanted. Need to remind Mr  Macron the U.K. includes NI.

Good to see a big fall in our trade deficit with the EU , as we buy more of our own food and goods and also find cheaper and better from the rest of the world . We used to import too much from the EU and can do better with more  jobs and business  at home.
The EU says the Good Friday Agreement matters, yet they do all they can to alienate the Unionist community in Northern Ireland by blocking GB to NI trade.
The EU at the G7 can be represented by Germany, France and Italy, three voices. So why does the EU also get to send two EU Presidents  as well to give them a majority?
Will the G7 propose the November world climate change conference  sets an example by showing how much can be done on line instead of all that global jet travel?

The G7 needs to ask what are the iconic Green products and services that people are going  to want to buy to make their lives better? Without these there are limits to what taxes, subsidies and more laws can achieve. See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5 for more.
The U.K. should be free to allow sausages passage from GB to Northern Ireland as long as it stops them going on to the EU. Not difficult to do.  The EU needs to act proportionately.

If President Biden wishes to back a good outcome on the island of Ireland he needs to press the EU to respect the U.K. internal market and the views of the majority in Northern Ireland. It is the EU disrupting trade.

Lord Frost should highlight the absurd difficulties the EU is deliberately creating to block GB to Northern Ireland trade. He should say the U.K. will run this trade  sensibly ensuring U.K. goods flow freely and stay in the U.K.
Glad the government has challenged the English Cricket Board. If someone made offensive remarks years ago and has  apologised we should accept their apology, not wreck their lives.

BBC Farming Today still on its wilding   agenda, with more negatives on free trade with anywhere other than the EU. When will they do something positive about the scope for farms to respond to the big demand for home grown food?
The U.K. should insist on the smooth functioning of our internal market between GB and Northern Ireland and enforce that. We should ignore EU petulant threats of legal action in their court.

Those who want us to spend more on overseas aid should add in all the money we spend on homes, school places and health facilities for refugees and economic migrants that we welcome here. The U.K. is a generous country on current figures.

Glad to see latest EY survey of global investors rank the  U.K. as the best place in Europe for inward investment. It also shows we have had another good year attracting businesses. Those Brexit worries by Remain MPs were  wrong again.

The U.K. can go on to help the world with vaccines. The government’s critics on overseas aid should recognise how much we do. They should ask the USA and other rich countries why they spend so much less than us as a proportion of their incomes.

People want to buy more home produced food, goods and services. They want to cut back on EU imports given the EU bullying over trade, fish and Northern  Ireland. See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5 on how we need a U.K. food and farming policy.

All this surge testing for CV 19 is designed to find more positives. These  should not be confused with more serious cases and more people needing hospital treatment. Only a surge in those is relevant for the decision on relaxing the current rules.
Government should stick with the plan to unlock on 21 June. Hospital admissions and deaths well down and so many now vaccinated.

BBC R4 Farming Today asked listeners to send in ideas for   their programme. I sent in ten to start to redress the anti Brexit and anti U.K. food production bias of their output. That will be ten good issues they continue to ignore.See them on https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5.
Radio 4 running stories this morning about how bad CV 19 is in Brazil and India again. Still no mention,  interview or visit to any EU  country with higher case and death rates.

Yesterday the  BBC asked me to appear on Newsnight about CV 19. I agreed a time and the link. Later they wanted to know in more detail what I would say. Then they failed to send the link as the way of cancelling. Clearly I had the wrong views for their story line. Yet again.

Latest worldometer figures show 50 countries with more CV19 cases per million than U.K. The vaccines are working. Also show only 16  countries with more deaths per million, so did the U.K. overstate deaths in the early days by using a less tight definition?
Just get on with relaxing the lockdown. Vaccines have brought the serious cases and deaths  right down which is what matters.

The Today programme joining in with the bizarre BBC view that intense and often unfair  competition to U.K. farms from the EU is fine but Free trade with the rest of the world will be damaging. Can they not see their own  bias In these contradictions?

As we edge back to a fuller life people need to use their cars more to shop, work and enjoy themselves. Councils should stop reducing road capacity for cars and start making  roads safer and freer flowing. See https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5 for how.
Why does the BBC usually ignore the EU in its CV 19 reporting? We might learn more if we heard why Hungary and Belgium have suffered so badly or how Denmark has kept the death rate so much lower.

The BBC 8am news said Brazil has the second highest death rate from CV 19 after the USA. No. Hungary has the highest death rate and the USA is well below many European countries. If they meant the highest total of deaths the EU sadly still leads that table.

Why do we hear about the tragic deaths from CV19 in India and Brazil but not in the EU/EEA? Sad news this week that deaths now reached 720,000 in EU/EEA.  Hungary, Bosnia and Czechia have the highest global death rates per million. What more can de done to help our neighbours?
Why do most BBC interviewers both believe a free trade agreement with the EU was vital to our economy yet a free trade agreement with Australia will be damaging?

Glad to see Switzerland rejected the EU’s power grab. Another neighbour the EU cannot get on with. Why does the EU assume it can take control of  the  laws of a neighbouring country if they suggest some friendly trade? The rest of the world does not try to boss you like this.
I am asking the government why the  COP 26 Conference to tell us to cut fuel use for heating, air conditioning and transport is not being held on line. Shouldn't it lead by example?

The U.K. needs factories to make batteries and electric  cars quickly if it still intends to ban all new petrol and diesel cars in 2030. 1.5 million batteries a year would be a good start. Closing all the existing vehicle plants would be a big blow to the industry otherwise.

The Environment Bill offers cleaner water. The government needs to require  more reservoir capacity so there is space to store excess water when rivers are prone to flood. Then if we have a dry hot summer  we can meet water demand without  running the streams too low.

Today as the Commons passed the Environment Bill I asked for some forecasts on total costs and phasing of the carbon and nature plans. It can only be a success if it goes at a pace the public accepts, with affordable and good products and services we want to buy.

Time to lift the threat of higher U.K. taxes. April numbers show extra state borrowing down on last year even before full  recovery is underway. More growth is the way to get the deficit down. Official forecasts of new debt are too pessimistic.

The Culture Secretary says the BBC should project British values and represent the whole nation. That will need a change  in approach by a broadcaster which represents the EU elite against  Brexit, ignores England and regularly takes the anti British side in arguments.

Why do all those now complaining about small quantities of Imported Australian beef hurting  our farmers not turn their attention to the much larger volume of imports of Irish beef tariff free which they seem to support?

Before telling us all to rip out our gas boilers government needs to tell us if and when Green hydrogen will be available in our homes. They also need to ask where all the electricity will come from if people are made to buy  heat pumps.

Why are we told free trade is essential with the  EU and dangerous with Australia or the USA? The same people who  demand the right of the EU to sell us  huge quantities of food tariff free want to stop the rest of the world competing.

The BBC review should ask why the  BBC ignores, attacks or dismisses the views of many it is meant to serve with its relentless politically correct agenda. It is still fighting Brexit, and exudes a superior distaste for any populist movement.
Time for a general review of BBC standards and impartiality. They have their own agenda which gets in the way of reflecting events and opinions in a great democracy they need to serve better.

We  will get better access to Australian products, with more opportunities for our exports. Those  who say we cannot compete with Australia backed massive EU Tariff free imports into U.K. but  don’t want the  EU to have to compete fairly  for  our  business.

If Great British Railways  can deliver good punctuality, more comfortable seats, clean carriages and a better timetable they will deserve the name. I pressed for the railway to be open to new ideas, more routes,  private capital, good property development and better catering.
The UK should sign what sounds like a great Free Trade Agreement with Australia, which should lead on to a wider Pacific area Agreement. See the case on https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5

The EU can ease controls on our trade when it suits them. They now want U.K. holidaymakers to go there despite the continuing high levels of virus cases and deaths, but are unable to relax their extreme controls on Northern Ireland trade. I’m looking forward to  my U.K. holiday.
The UK should just take control of our own internal market into and out of  Northern Ireland. I set out how on https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5.
People now have a choice  of vaccine or staying  away from others to keep safe from getting a serious  case of CV 19. No need to keep the domestic controls in place.
Why do people who campaign about climate change think they should fly round the world to conferences instead of holding an on line event?

The UK government should control all movement of goods between GB and Northern Ireland. The EU should only have an interest in goods that are marked to go on the Republic. The UK must take control if the EU is trying to stop internal UK trade.
Mass vaccination  must lead to unlocking. No need for a wobble about the timetable now. The data on hospital admissions and deaths shows vaccines work.

Big day for Northern Ireland with DUP leadership election and PM talks over NI Protocol. The UK must ensure smooth flow of trade between GB and NI with or without EU agreement. The Protocol says it respects the UK's single market so UK must speed the flow of goods.

Plenty of support for better appointment systems for NHS services. People want to know they can get an appointment when they need one, with a good responsive phone service as well as an on line option.

Todays trade figures show in March compared with March 2019 pre pandemic  we cut back substantially on EU imported goods. The EU policy of trying to harm our trade  is hurting them. Annoying the customer is never a good idea. We bought more  from the rest of the world.

Good to see Labour Deputy leader saying more people want  a helping hand so fewer will need hand outs. Levelling up must be based on more private investment, more self employment, more small business expansion and more individual opportunity.

Yesterday I raised the issue of appointment systems for GP surgeries. I would like them all to do what the good ones do   - let you book for an on line or face to face by phone or web with a prompt answer and choice of dates.
As even the SNP agrees there should be no independence referendum anytime soon can we now talk about something  else? Let’s get on with making lives in the U.K. better and have a great recovery.

The Scottish election showed  a majority of those voting averaging  the constituency and top up vote voted to stay in the U.K. The U.K. government saying  NO to a referendum is reflecting the wishes of Scottish voters. The SNP failed to win the vote for a referendum.

Leave voters reminded candidates we want to see positive change taking advantage of our new freedoms as an independent country.  Too many Opposition parties still want to tell Brexit voters off for voting to leave. They should show some enthusiasm for what we can now achieve.
The Post Office edges ahead to cancelling the false allegations against Postmasters. Still no full compensation or proper apology to many who deserve both.

The Today programme today is cross examining voters who dared to vote Conservative to press them as to why. They do not demand people voting Labour or SNP to explain their vote. They told them it appeared they were voting for the party of Thatcher in a 40 year flashback!
Congratulations to new Hartlepool MP. People want a good recovery and positive change. Labour talked about the wrong things and are still negative about the future of our newly independent country.

I found voters wanted to talk about local issues and to hear about how Councillors could help make their lives better. The national media talking about Wallpaper was out of touch with an election about how we can have a decent recovery with local improvements.

Time to hear the case of the UK and Jersey fishing industries  against the unfair treatment from  the EU and France. They have a  much better case than the French fishing industry against the UK. We are trying to protect our fishing grounds from EU overfishing.
Glad Jersey has a back up power supply. Most important not to give in to unacceptable French bullying. We need to take back control of our fish.

The G7 Foreign Ministers should talk about China wanting to dominate output and sales of  green products and materials whilst continuing to increase her emissions. That’s not a sensible way of carrying through a green revolution.
There are many great places for holidays in the  U.K. with less risk of cancellation or long quarantine this summer than going abroad.  Why not try one?
Why is Welsh government buying electric buses from China? As in the Times today we do need to buy these new products from U.K. manufacturers by encouraging more capacity and competition at home.

The voters I talk to want to hear more from  parties about how they would make things better for people and how they would spend public money wisely. There's not enough debate about how local and devolved government  might  help provide a better future.

Sad to see EU deaths from CV 19 have surged to 678,000 compared to USA at 590,000 with fewer new deaths. The EU Commission needs to work more positively with overseas companies making vaccines to get on top of this pandemic.

If you want to turn the  Scottish election into a single issue about another independence referendum  you should explain how you think independence would work. What currency? Could you join the EU? What trade and border  with the U.K.? What cost?  What defence policy?

China has said they will continue to increase their output of carbon dioxide whilst trying to dominate the  supply of products the West would need to cut its CO2. How does it help for us to stop making things to cut our CO2 if we import them  from carbon creating China?

Worldwide governments are setting tough decarbonisation targets. We need to let  the private sector catch up by finding the good value better green products that people want to buy as  they want us to change our cars, our boilers, our diets, our travel  and much else.

Yesterday I called for full compensation for Postmasters wrongly accused by the Post Office. This public body owes them for the Horizon software Losses, for their legal fees to get justice, and for the loss of earnings inflicted on them. The Post Office did so much harm.

The EU has been giving overseas aid to China, a country with $3.2 trillion of reserves. The U.K. has been sending aid money to the EU to spend for us. The U.K. is right  to stop aid to China and needs to take control of all our own aid budget.
Time for DEFRA to spell out more of its plans to back more home grown food. Public goods they pay for need to be more than some wild areas.
The way the EU is treating Northern Ireland and some U.K. food exports to the continent  is a great reason to buy local and buy British where possible or buy from countries that do help trade flow.
The UK should send some more emergency medical supplies to India.

UK borrowing to March 21  came in £91 bn less than the official November forecast because economy did a bit better. If we get everyone back to work now the vaccines are working State borrowing will plunge.Let’s get on with a great recovery. The Treasury is too gloomy.
President Biden pledging big cuts in other people’s output of carbon dioxide.   Is he going to green the Presidency with its Carbon intensive lifestyle?
Sad to see the departure of Johnny Mercer from government. He has battled bravely to get better treatment for our veterans. Let’s hope he gets them justice.
Great news that football fans do matter. Their more sensible views have prevailed. Good too that government doesn’t have to intervene in deciding how the sport runs its competitions.
The government has promised us new economic rules and aims. Let's dump the EU  debt rules the Treasury is still using and go for faster growth with low inflation instead.

The government's tax rises to come are based on forecasts of  borrowing. For 2020-21 the official forecasters great overstated the actual borrowing. They could be doing the same for future years. No need to rush tax rises before we know more about the deficit after recovery.
A European elite chooses its own members,ignores fair criticisms, cannot be sacked and profits from the public it scorns. Why do some football clubs think this a good model?
World governments need to watch out when pressing for faster decarbonising targets. Important some large industrial countries do not go slow to gain advantage and push others out of business.

Latest figures from Migration Observatory say there were a lot more migrants from the EU over the last decade and many fewer from the rest of the world than the official numbers. We need accurate data to inform a fair and effective borders policy.

Lower tax rates bring in more revenue. 22 leading countries charged  business profits at 46.2% in the 1980s and collected 2.4% of GDP in tax. In the last ten years they charged 26.7% and collected  2.9% of GDP. Good figures from Cato Institute based on OECD numbers.

The U.K. government should tell the EU it is going to enforce the integrity of the UK’s internal market as promised in the Agreement by allowing easy entry of all GB goods going to NI for delivery there. They should not be held up by the EU.

The government should review the death figures for  CV19 to clear up how many were deaths from the disease. The current death  figures in relation to cases look too high compared to many comparable countries when we have  similar  treatments and patient care.

The U.K. Treasury should spend more time on measures to grow and support the economy and less on devising new and higher taxes. The way to get more tax revenue is to boost business, jobs and incomes, not to threaten people with bigger taxes.

Joe Biden's proposal for a minimum world corporation tax rate of 21% would mean a near doubling of the Irish rate of 12.5%. I assume the EU supports this as a way to a more level playing field. Could have quite an impact on investment flows.

The UK has a vaccine success in protecting so many people from the serious versions of CV 19. Now for an economic success by relaxing controls to start saving livelihoods. The UK can have a great economic revival if we let people open businesses and get on safely with recovery.

Plenty of media comment on sad increases in Brazilian Covid deaths above  330,000. Meanwhile EU deaths rise above 600,000. The truth is there are too many deaths in various European as well as S.American countries. These need careful analysis of why and how it can be changed.

Continuing weak UK car sales figures show it is easier to put people off buying diesel and petrol cars than it is to get the necessary  volumes for battery vehicles. Different types of electric sales are up despite CV 19 measures but not nearly enough to offset the ICE losses.

Why do I keep seeing comments about the U.K. having the highest death rate from CV 19? The worldometer shows 10 countries in Europe with higher rates and shows sadly faster rises in the rate in many other countries at a time our rate is falling fast.
The government should take more action to control people entering the  country  as illegal migrants or tourists given its controls over our rights to travel abroad.

Good news the CV19 Death rate in U.K. has fallen right back. Too many past recorded deaths means U.K. is 11th worst on the worldometer for deaths per million by country.Sad news to now see faster rises in deaths in many other countries.

Glad the government is not now proposing vaccine passports to go to a cafe, restaurant  or pub. It’s time to re open now those at risk of serious disease from CV19 have been offered the vaccine. Still no agreed policy  on big events.

Challenge to Ministers - what have you done to take advantage of our new freedoms out of the EU? When do we get the tax cuts, the rebuilding of the UK’s fishing and  farming Industries, the intelligent use of U.K. public sector buying and policy to create more jobs in the U.K.?
The U.K. was once again too generous with the  EU , this time over investment in vaccine production. What a bad response from the EU after a great move from the U.K. to put in more vaccine capacity.
The vaccine story shows the importance of making things at home in factories the UK can regulate, working with good businesses for a joint success.

The EU has failed to use all the Astra vaccine supplied so far.  Demanding more vaccine delivery and casting doubts on the vaccine at the same time is not the way to get people vaccinated quickly and in large numbers.

A top DEFRA official did not mention growing more food as an aim of the new UK farming policy she is working on in her Farming Today interview.  Parliament made clear to Ministers boosting UK food production matters. Ministers need to clarify what is going on.

Germany has changed its mind on the Astra vaccine yet again. We’ve   had don’t use it, use it for all, use it just for the younger people and use it just for older people. If they want more people to want and  get  a vaccine they need to back one view of this leading  product.

Glad the U.K. is putting in more vaccine manufacturing capacity at home. We need to promote more manufacturing here for many items.  This  creates  more jobs and cuts  the import bill. Overseas supplies are subject to many interruptions in this current world.
As the U.K. will have spare vaccines when all is done at home the government can decide which countries to help out and on what basis.

As the U.K. government pushes hard to electric vehicles it has  to remember all the factories and jobs at risk making diesel ones. It needs to help get the U.K. into a position where it can make popular and affordable EVs so we do not simply lose all the car jobs we have.

Great news that we can now book some events, meals out, holidays in the U.K. as the controls come off. Those who have the income or savings can help revive jobs and rebuild livelihoods for others by getting out more as soon as it allowed.

The EU Summit sent out  threats  as member states argued over export bans and  allocations of vaccine. It seems the EU does not feel the need to obey its own treaties over free trade and good relations with neighbouring states and companies.

The EU should spend less time arguing over how to share out the vaccines we can make and more time ensuring more vaccines are made. That means co-operating with great companies who are getting on with the task of increasing production.
In a democracy freedom can be lost or suspended with the best of intentions. I saw  no need yesterday for another six months of emergency powers.
Today Parliament can and should relax more of the restrictions and save more livelihoods. The vaccine success gives us the opening to restore more jobs and businesses.

Astra Zeneca is offering the lowest price successful vaccine on a not for profit basis. It does not deserve all the criticisms and false accusations it is getting from the EU and elsewhere. Glad the U.K. wants to work with this company for the greater good.

The EU is having a row with Norway over fish, with leading world vaccine companies over supply, with customers in Northern Ireland over access to GB products. Why can’t it get on with neighbours and business and promote more free trade?

EU unjustified  attacks on whether the Astra vaccine works have changed to threats of export bans and trade blockades as they cannot get enough of it. How does this square with their U.K. Free Trade Agreement and the WTO global trade rules which they are meant to obey?

Now the most vulnerable half of the U.K. population has been vaccinated we should look forward to very low serious case rates in future. The experts should have confidence in their remedy and unlock the economy. .

Good to see government borrowing coming in well below the official November forecast. Need to get it down much more  in 2021-2 by getting the economy back to work and re opening hospitality and leisure here in the UK.
Good to hear Gilbraltar has vaccinated all adults who wanted the protection  thanks to UK help.

The government's decision to support UK science and business in developing a vaccine, and to forward buy substantial quantities has led to an expansion of good jobs and UK production capacity in pharma. We can use the same approach to expand other  UK industries.
Why does the EU demand more Astra vaccine  deliveries when some of its member states have not been using the doses they do have?

President Biden's Executive Order of 24 February sets out plans to onshore more industry to the USA,  develop more crucial technologies at home, create more high value jobs and spend tax money on US made goods and services. Now we are an independent country we can do the same.
The EU should remember it agreed to respect the UK’s single market. This needs easy access from GB to Northern Ireland for internal U.K. trade.

The huge US stimulus and money  creation runs  the risk of inflation. The U.K. is being more cautious. To make sure prices stay down the U.K. needs to make a big investment  in increased capacity in many areas. Everything from food to electricity, broadband to timber.
Time for a national boost for successful vaccinations and the continuing big fall of serious virus cases. Let’s get on with a safe  return to reviving services.

The U.K. shellfish industry should consider government help to purify their catch in the U.K. so it can be sold here in shops or to food manufacturers to include in great meals and recipes. Add the value and create the jobs here.

I’m asking UK supermarkets to work more closely with the U.K. fishing and farming industries to get more domestic food into  their shops. There is a hunger for great U.K. food and for more local products.

The huge US fiscal stimulus relative to size shows the UK is not taking such a big  risk with borrowings and money creation. Let's hope the boost works in the USA as it will  help the world economy to recover more quickly. The US is now sending money to each adult to spend.
The EU agreed to respect  the UK’s single Market. It is important goods can travel easily between GB and Northern Ireland when they are part of our single market under  our rules.

The government's levelling up fund needs to harness plenty of business and private investment and community energy to provide a big and broad boost to recipients. It should include helping business make more of the things we need here at home.

Glad to see the UK government is out to  ensure the free flow of goods within the UK single market as agreed with the EU. A UK supermarket needs to be able to send food from GB to Northern Ireland easily.

Great news that the US has suspended tariffs on Scotch whisky, cashmere, UK cheeses and other items, imposed as part of the dispute with the EU over aircraft. The UK's policy of promoting global free trade has brought an early and unexpected gain for important UK exporters.

Urged the government In the Budget debate to do  more to speed and promote recovery. OBR cut their deficit forecast by £39bn for this year reminding us how difficult it is to get the numbers right. The way to beat the deficit down is strong recovery.

Tomorrow the OBR will give us new forecasts. It's difficult to forecast the deficit with the CV 19  measures varying. They will likely cut their last estimate  of £394 bn borrowing this year, given numbers so far. They should  show a big deficit fall next year as we recover.

Those who want higher taxes should spell out their deficit forecasts for next year. They should also explain how Ireland raises so much more money from business profits than we do as a proportion of the economy  when they have a much lower rate of tax than us.

When lockdown is lifted tax revenues will surge and the special spending on the pandemic will end. The way to get the deficit down is to promote  a strong recovery. Hiking taxes would slow recovery and could mean a bigger deficit.

I am urging David Frost to tackle the fishing and Northern Ireland trade issues as soon as possible. The UK should show it has taken back control by supervising free flows of trade from GB to NI, and rebuilding our fishing industry to land more of our own fish.

The way to get the deficit down is to get back to work as soon as possible. Spending shot up and tax revenue collapsed thanks to closure and job losses. Time to reverse the bad news and to promote recovery.
Good to see many more people are now vaccinated. Time to get the benefits of this by speeding up the relaxation of business from Easter onwards

An ex French Ambassador to London  says the EU is now united in  a Napoleonic blockade of the UK. I thought they had signed a Free Trade Agreement and wanted to export to us. Still plenty of EU products in shops.

Ireland with a business tax rate of just 12.5% collects much more business tax in proportion  to its economy than we do with a higher rate. Sometimes you need lower rates to bring in more money and to cut deficits. Let's  promote recovery and business  to get the deficit down.
It was easy to lose freedoms to save lives. We must not think this is now normal or acceptable. As vaccines protect the vulnerable we should restore our liberties.

Yesterday I restated my advice that the last thing the UK economy needs now is tax rises. Every policy should be geared to promoting economic recovery. We need the full energy of the self employed and small business back at work  to get us out of the CV 19 recession.
With so many now vaccinated it is time to unlock. Hospitality, leisure and retail need customers and revenue soon.

Australia and Facebook invite us to discuss how to  pay for journalism. We should ask the BBC which we all pay for to offer more news and less one sided "expert" commentary, more events and facts, fewer forecasts and repeated campaigns.
I am pressing the government to do more to control infection spread in hospitals through better air systems, UV cleaning and the rest , to allow more non Covid work to take place safely.
Small business needs to be given more of a chance to open up and earn some money. We need a good timetable for unlocking the economy, to rebuild all those services which make life enjoyable.
Glad to see Lord  Frost in government. The priority must be restoring all trade flows between GB and Northern Ireland ASAP. The Agreement says our single market is respected  and should work.
Next week is a big week. A timetable to end  lock down and a budget. Everything must be about recovery  and jobs. The U.K. needs to get back to school  and work .

I do hope the Treasury is listening to voices saying we need a good package for the self employed to help them back to work as controls are  relaxed. Time for lower tax rates, not higher, and easier tax rules. Many of them  had a tough time  with lockdown.
Getting a  delivery of Cornish fish  this week from an  internet order as some  supermarkets still not offering enough UK fresh produce.
I’m asking the government to increase U.K. electricity capacity. We need to replace the imports, build sufficient for increased demand and to handle bad weather. We do not want future power cuts.

Past UK government has given grants and much support to making diesel engines for cars in the UK. We have some good factories.  Now they want to end diesel sales  they need to show the same determination  to build the replacements here.

Every incentive and help should now be offered to the self employed and small  business to get back to work and to expand their capacity. The way to bring the deficit down is to grow our economy and reward enterprise. More taxes would mean less recovery.

Once the nine most vulnerable categories of people have been offered vaccines it must be time to be back at school and work. Let’s start with the schools early March and the hospitality industry  for Easter.
Good to hear Government say more and better treatments are likely for CV 19. I am asking more questions about progress with drug treatment trials here and around the world.

Let's have  more determination  from our government to boost our fishing industry. There are plenty of options to help them to land, process and sell more of our  fish as we take control of our waters effectively.

With so many now vaccinated we do need a timetable to unlock our economy. We need the mighty army of the self employed and small businesses to be allowed to open up again before we lose more of them from closures and losses.

Today I asked for better plans to reopen our High Streets and town centres as soon as possible. We need help from Councils to make it easier to get to them and to park, and encouragement for shops, cafes and restaurants.

The government says it is thinking of reforms or reorganisation of the NHS. We need to put the pandemic behind  us first and then think through if changes are needed in the light of how the management has managed.

I raised with the Environment Secretary in the Commons the need for him to work with food retailers to help them sell more home produced food and promote U.K. caught fish. Help the shellfish industry invest and process at home.

As the government plans an electric revolution it needs to expand generating capacity quickly. With nuclear stations retiring and more wind power we need more back up capacity. Pump storage, hydro and biomass help.
Well done Cadbury. Great to hear production of the Dairy Milk  bar is coming home to the U.K.
The Bank of England has asked banks to prepare for negative interest rates, without yet wanting them. They are a  bad idea. There are better ways to back the economic recovery  we now need.
Will the government’s fishing and farming Ministers speed up help for home industry to expand its domestic market?  We want more U.K. produce in our shops and an expanding   Industry.
Will the supermarkets buy the shellfish the EU will not take and work with our fishing industry to sell it to U.K. buyers?
More good news on Astra Zeneca vaccine. More reason to plan safe return to work and school.

Glad to see U.K. government is now engaging with GB/Northern Ireland trade issues. They need to smooth out all internal U.K. trade so it runs as before January. The EU should not be allowed to damage it.

Today the government should set out plans to Parliament to take back control of our single market. They need to speed trade between GB and Northern Ireland and sort out agricultural trade and fishing.

Will DEFRA take the enthusiasm for people to buy more home produced food seriously?   It should help our farmers and fishing businesses produce and sell more at home. I want my local supermarkets to be full of great British food, lowering food miles   and helping home businesses.

The government should take speedy action to deal with EU blocks on U.K. exports of fish and farm products. It could start by buying British itself for government needs and working with supermarkets to sell more excellent home produced food.

Economic recovery will rely on the self employed and small business getting back to work and going for all the new opportunities. The Treasury should improve its support for their pandemic damage and give them a tax cut. Getting the deficit down needs faster growth.
Environmental groups are right to ask for a new business case for HS2. The original one was weak and now future demand for business and commuting travel will be reduced.
