Glad the EU now agree the NI Protocol does not work well. Time for a reset that promotes trade. Time for the EU to listen to what people want on both sides of the land border between NI and the Republic.

Glad the EU seems to be withdrawing its export ban on vaccines. UK government must now ensure smooth trade between NI and GB without EU interference and restrictions. Still need more clarity and an apology from the EU who cynically use the Irish border as a lever.

The U.K. must now legislate to take control of GB/ Northern Ireland trade and our fish. The EU’s conduct on vaccines is unacceptable. They should apologise to Astra Zeneca and remove their threats to our trade.

The EU’s bad  conduct over vaccines is disruptive to the world effort against the pandemic. Astra Zeneca is part of the answer to the virus, not the problem. Brilliant news the U.K. has another vaccine almost ready for domestic production.

The EU attacks the Union of the U.K. by trying to disrupt trade between GB and Northern Ireland, whilst Nicola Sturgeon tries to use the EU as  a lever against the Union. The PM needs to stand up to these challenges and to legislate a U.K. solution to trade and fish.
The U.K. needs to intervene urgently to free the flow of goods between GB and Northern Ireland. The U.K. needs to uphold the U.K. single market for all users.

For weeks the EU failed to give regulatory permission for the AstraZ  vaccine, implying there could be a problem. Now it’s cross that the U.K. got on with it and has vaccinated more people.  They should apologise for their  attacks  on  AZ  who  have  worked so hard on this.

The EU’s threats to trade in vaccines is a warning to us. We need to increase our own ability to make and grow things at home, not rely on too many EU imports. A new fishing, farming, energy and manufacturing policy is needed.
The EU wants to break contracts over vaccine export sales to threaten others. They only believe in international law and rules when it suits them. Good job most of our vaccines are made in the U.K.

No need for another vote in Scotland on staying in the U.K. so soon after the last  one.  The  SNP   said  once  in  a  generation.  Set out the advantages of the UK’s single market, currency and defence Unions. Spare us Project Fear again.
Gordon Brown’s lop sided devolution policy fuelled Scottish nationalism and is unfair on England.His latest suggestions would make things worse.
I’m asking the government when it fosters tree planting to encourage sustainable forestry so we can cut the imports of wood.

There is plenty of support for growing more of our own food. Tell your local supermarket we want more U.K. produce. I am pressing the government to get behind our farmers and fishing industry. Not much choice of U.K. cheeses, fruit  and veg in some shops.

The last thing the U.K. now needs is a tax rise. We need to get the deficit down by getting safely back to work and growing the economy. The lock downs have done great damage to livelihoods. Tax rises would harm recovery.

Yesterday in Parliament I called for Government  urgency in giving us more of the Brexit wins. Bring on the policies to boost home grown food, increase  our fishing fleet, set up freeports and Enterprise Zones, cut VAT.

Democracy thrives on strong disagreements and constitutional opposition. The unity you should strive for  is agreement about the fairness of elections and the ways of debate and decision taking. I wish the new US President well in reaching out to all those who disagree with him.
The world will only take the  U.K. seriously if we show we act independently of  the EU. The U.K. believes in free trade and democracy, peace and human rights, which it has a fine history promoting.

The government needs to enforce the rights of U.K. traders to buy and sell into and out of Northern Ireland as they always have done in the past.  The U.K. Union thrives on an open and free U.K. single market which the EU wants to disrupt with its approach to Northern Ireland.

Standing  up for U.K. values does not mean giving in to every EU demand. There is a big difference between supporting  a moral international order and accepting every attempt by the EU to assert their interests over ours.
The government needs to give urgent attention to the passage of goods between Northern Ireland and GB. Legislate to take control of all internal U.K. trade to help  the hauliers and ferries.

Glad to see the Chancellor is Chairing a Committee to deliver us some of the Brexit wins. He should start with a Brexit bonus budget, removing VAT from green products and energy and offering more help to small business.
Still many self employed and small businesses left without government financial help. If you are stopped from working and trading you should be compensated. I keep on pressing Ministers to do better.
Time for the government to sort out the fishing issues. The industry expects a better deal. There's plenty the government can do to improve things.

Yesterday I urged the government to legislate to ensure the free flow of goods for Northern Ireland within the UK. We should not allow the EU to disrupt trade within the UK. The rest of the world is very willing to supply those things we cannot provide for ourselves.

The government  needs to take urgent action to ensure free movement of goods between Northern Ireland and GB. We voted to take control of our own laws,taxes, borders and trade rules for the whole U.K. Let’s get on with it.

Time for the government to ban very large foreign trawlers with large and heavy gear damaging our fish stocks and marine environment. They say they do not have a definition of such trawlers. Not difficult to invent one.

There are big opportunities for U.K. business in import substitution. Let’s cut the food miles by growing more at home. We need to increase the amount of U.K. value added  in manufactures by making more components here, simplifying supply chains and creating more jobs.

If the government really does plan this lockdown to last well into  March it must offer decent financial  support for the many small businesses it has closed down. We need them to survive the winter so they can lead the recovery and  employ people again.

Without bad news on Brexit  the  BBC now regularly makes news out of predictions of what might go wrong in the future. Try reporting what is happening  not what people hostile to Brexit think might happen.

We need a clear statement from the Examining Boards on how they will assess students this year. We need a system that is fair, motivates pupils and provides a good standard of qualification for the hard work.
A week after Brexit and Dover port working fine. Still no apologies from the Project Fear commentators and media forecasters.
Yesterday Parliament urged the government to speed up vaccination so they can lift the lock down.Time to take up some of the many offers of help to get the job done.
As the government advisers see the vaccine as the only way out of lock down why aren’t they using pharmacies to help speed up vaccination? Will they speed up the return of qualified staff to the NHS?
We need new approaches to tackling this virus. When all political parties and most officials agree things often go wrong.

Will press the government today for better answers on use of the Nightingales, available NHS capacity, improved ways of controlling infection, safeguarding  the vulnerable and speed of roll out of the vaccine.
Will NHS top management find ways to improve infection control so more staff are safe and available to work? Will they make it easier for recently retired staff to return to help manage the CV bulge?

We need to know what is the current capacity of the NHS and how they can make DG hospitals safer by better air extraction and UV cleaning. Why not use Nightingales and some others as specialist CV 19 facilities to cut cross infection?
So what will the BBC put in their news bulletins as it turns out the Project fear stories for Brexit day were wrong?

The EU website runs a forecast that their combined GDP will decline from 15% of  the world total to 9% by 2050. That means huge trade opportunities elsewhere, especially Asia. Global UK will benefit from more free trade all round the world.

Media reports no delays for trucks at Dover. Quite unlike the chaos of last month when we were in the single market. Time for the media to cheer up about the majority democratic decision of a great independent nation.
Happy new year and happy Independence Day. Time for something better now we can decide for ourselves.
BBC’s Today programme is inviting guest editors to explore themes they normally ignore. So why no guest editor to explore all the opportunities the U.K. has once out of the EU? Too radical for them.
Tonight I will celebrate new year and Independence Day with a glass of brilliant sparkling English wine. Don’t worry, the family gathering will be on zoom.

Parliament should not go back into recess. The government should now bring forward VAT changes, new laws for fishing, freeports, enterprise zones and new schemes for home food production. We should use our new freedoms and boost jobs and business.

It is one thing to take back legal control, it is another to take effective control. I am urging the government to use our new freedoms from our first day as an independent country. Let's boost our prosperity, as set out on https://t.co/8ZUuM6CZ0U

Why do EU supporters assume the  EU will break international law and seek to block U.K. goods and tourists at Calais once we have left? Our borders work fine with  the rest of the world who are not members of the EU, and goods move with computer based information exchanges.

Government should set out plans for a much bigger U.K. fishing industry and better marine environment protection. Bring on the plans for food and fish processing and exporting as well as replacing imports. Coastal communities need more jobs and businesses not hand  outs.
Will the government now ban foreign supertrawlers and pulse fishing in our seas? That would show we had taken back control and look after our fishing grounds and marine environment.
Will Michael Gove publish the details of his agreement on  the Northern Ireland issues? We need a detailed text to see how he thinks it is going to work.

Proof that this Brexit deal takes back control will rest on all the laws and taxes the government now improves or repeals to make our lives better. I’m sending them a list of proposals. See https://t.co/8ZUuM6CZ0U.

Happy Christmas everyone. 

Here's a Christmas story with a happy ending. https://t.co/MKdGHlj5a6

Now we must use our new freedoms to rebuild our fishing industry, increase home food production,boost transport,manufacturing and energy.All these suffered from unhelpful EU laws, taxes and trade policies.Bring  on policies to help UK business.
Any UK/EU Agreement must put us in full control of our laws, and needs an exit clause we can use without EU permission.
Continuing collapse of car sales is all down to the pandemic and attacks on diesel and petrol cars. It’s nothing to do with Brexit. The industry should work on the causes of its big loss of output.

Glad France has rethought the needless damage to trade and disruption to the lives of lorry drivers. Time to get things moving. Forcing drivers out of their cabs to live through a delay makes virus spread more likely.
Over 600,000 people a year, mainly elderly,  die every year in U.K. This year flu and pneumonia deaths well down. Why do we not get daily updates on these figures as well as CV 19 deaths?

Time for Ministers and  top NHS management to explain what increases in all types  of  capacity they have made,  what they are doing on infection  control and why they are not using the Nightingales. Need to protect staff better using isolation units with great  security.

The last thing we want is more uncertainty by asking for an extension to talks with EU. They have spent four and a half years offering us a rotten deal to undermine Brexit so how would an extension help?
French closure of ports owing to CV19 whilst we are in the single market is bad news. Time to use the  lorry parks we have built. We rely on imports  too much. Let’s grow and make more at home.
Recall Parliament. The government should consider  other ways of tackling the virus, protecting the NHS and saving more businesses and livelihoods.
Wales went for a tougher lockdown and has had more cases and deaths per million than England. Time for a U.K. rethink on how to fight the virus.
The EU has made clear they do not want a fair free trade agreement. They want to control our laws, stop us backing our business, and take our fish. Time for an independent UK.
The EU has just had four and half more years of over fishing our seas. That’s a long  transition. Time to take back control.
Glad the U.K. is insisting on controlling our laws, fish, taxes and state aids.We voted to be independent , not for a compromise. Free trade Agreement or No deal are the options.

Glad the PM confirmed the U.K. can have a great future with an Australian style WTO Relationship with the EU. As The EU and U.K. are both members we will trade on  most  favoured  nation  terms. Economists agree we will have good growth in the economy next year any way.

The UK has now agreed Free Trade deals with 58 countries before leaving the EU Customs Union. No apologies yet from those who said we would lose all EU trade deals on leaving. I  look forward to us agreeing to join the large Pacific partnership which the EU has not joined.
Glad the government is dropping its proposed algorithm or targets to concentrate new house building in the South East. We need levelling up and investment well spread around the country.
The government should tell us the facts about the spread  of the virus and let people decide how best to try to keep their families safe  over Christmas.
If the government wants us all to use electricity to heat our homes and power our vehicles they need to put in bigger cables and a lot more power generation to make it possible.
The U.K. needs more electricity capacity. The government needs to make decisions about how, not just more consultations.
The BBC keeps on re running Project Fear. No interviews on how we can use our freedoms with a  clean Brexit to be a much better and more prosperous country.

Time for the government to set out how we will use all the freedoms we win if we just leave the EU without a new legal lock up. Bring on the VAT cuts, the Freeports,the ways to grow more of our own food. See more ideas on https://t.co/dkh8g5C3W5
A long complex legal Agreement that locks the UK back into many features of the EU that hinder us is not the Christmas present the UK needs.
Will the Cabinet Office stop behaving as if it believes Project Fear scares? Tell us how we will use our new freedoms from EU exit to create a more prosperous U.K.
End the talks. The EU wants to stop us being independent. They cannot stop our trade. People and businesses buy and sell under WTO rules.  The EU just makes empty threats.

Please Michael Gove set out how we will use our new freedoms to improve our country  instead of responses to Project Fear predictions. 
Bring on the tax cuts, Freeports, and Enterprise Zones. Lets have more home grown food and manufactured products. Brexit helps levelling up.

EU industrial trawlers have been hoovering up fish in UK waters in the last days under EU control. Glad we will patrol our waters as we have been doing, but this time to enforce our rules. We can have a fishing policy kinder to our industry and marine environment.

Will the Cabinet Office stop running Project Fear and calling it a worst case scenario? Our exporters and importers handle non EU trade with tariffs and EU style declarations just fine today so they will quite capable of handling No Deal EU trade when it comes.
The EU sounds rattled and is making idle threats. Time to look after its citizens and companies who want to trade easily with an independent U.K.

The EU issues hollow threats on trade. They will have to follow World Trade Organisation rules on imports to allow smooth passage of goods at borders. Their exporters also have rights in EU and international law.

Project fear continues to pour out nonsense about a No deal Brexit, based on empty threats. The U.K. trades well with China, the USA and many others under WTO rules and with all  the EU barriers and tariffs in place . Supply lines and our borders work fine for this.

Well done to the  PM  for  standing  up  for  an  independent  UK.  Great news the U.K. continues to sign trade deals around the world. A bad EU deal would stop that by taking away our freedoms to decide our own laws and tariffs. We will be both free and prosperous.

Glad the PM explained again the U.K. intends to be an independent country like Australia. The U.K. offer of a Free trade deal is a generous one given the large imbalance in trade. We regain our  independence  with  No  deal.  Deal has to improve on that, not take it away.

There is so much more we can grow and make for ourselves. We need freedom from single market rules to do so. The rules have plunged us into  colossal  deficit on trade in food and goods with the EU.The EU wants to keep it that way by locking us in.

Yesterday I asked Labour and the SNP if they could name any U.K. ask of the EU in the talks that they supported. Neither could! They would not even support the U.K. takimg back full control of our fish. They clearly want  the  the U.K. to give in again.

Just leaving  the EU Looks better and better. Look at how they tried to entrap us once again under their rules.  We must leave the single market where we have a huge trade deficit. Let’s have our own rules and tariffs which let us make and grow more  at  home.
The EU is allowing huge subsidies and state aids to its businesses. No sign of a level play field there, yet they still want to stop us helping our businesses. No deal is better than an unfair  deal.

Controlling our own fishing grounds still better than France’s scaled back demand. They have just had four and a half years of our fish thanks to the damage and delays done by Remain to the U.K. position. Why more years?

We know how to import without a free trade deal. We do it every day from China, the USA and others. No need for more Project Fear. Once out of the  EU we control our own borders so no need to block our own imports.  We will set the tariffs and keep the money.
Tariff Free trade is the best offer we should make to the EU. It’s a pity they do not understand the importance to us of being a free independent country.
Time to end the EU talks. The EU still wants to keep 70% of our fish. We have not asked to take any of their natural resources. Their demand is insulting.
If France and Germany want tariff free access to the UK market they need to drop their claims to control our laws and take our fish. No deal is much better than their deal for the UK.
Well done PM and David Frost. No need to give away our fish or our law making powers. We voted to be an independent country. The EU has to decide if it wants a Free Trade Agreement or not.
No deal is better than a bad deal. It should be easy saying No to anything which stops us being an independent self governing country.

Message to government. Set out the many wins from Brexit. Use our new freedoms well. Get us out without surrendering our fish, our borders, our laws. We voted to be independent. Once free we can do better.

I asked  Government yesterday to promote home grown food.There are big opportunities as we put in a replacement for the EU policies which have cut our capacity to feed ourselves. The Minister agreed  but needs to bring in the schemes to cut those  food miles.

Why are the EU criticising the U.K. for getting on with regulating the vaccine? They need to get used  to us making our own decisions. If the EU has a problem with this product they should share it with the world.
Is a Scotch egg a substantial meal? The government’s latest law is unclear. How can you enforce a law if Ministers cannot tell you what it means?
Tax cuts work. The Stamp duty cut has given a big boost to people buying the home they want. Let’s have some more tax cuts to get more people back to work.

Livelihoods  matter.The government needs to do more to help the hospitality industry. Where is the promised work on air extraction and other ways of making indoors safer? Where is the extra  financial help for small businesses?

Why not  open and staff all the Nightingale hospital capacity they need for CV 19 cases and get the rest of the NHS back to full capacity for everything else?   No need to scare us with the idea the NHS will not cope.
The UK should be setting out great plans to expand our fishing fleet and increase our food processing industries as we take back control of our seas. Read how on https://t.co/XWUitdW203

Why has Mr Barnier come to London to insult us with an offer of a tiny part of our own fish back? He wants us to stay tied to single market rules and tariffs, locked into a new legal nightmare. We voted to leave the single market and to be free.
We do not want to surrender our fish, our laws and our courts to the EU. If the EU still wants us to compromise on these there should be no more talks.
The Prime Minister promised us we could just leave the EU if there was no deal by October 15th. Time to deliver the promise.

When is the Chancellor going to take up the wins from Brexit? We want VAT off essential products. We need a farm subsidy scheme that promotes more U.K. grown and reared food. We want a fund to expand our fishing fleet and help our fish processing industry. Let’s get on with  it.

Mr Barnier threatens to end the talks as the UK hasn't caved in. It's good news as we must be  sticking to the truth  there is no need to give away our fish, our right to make our own laws and control our own borders just so Germany can sell us cars tariff free. Your move EU.

Today we need a big stimulus to get us out of the big recession. We also need measures to get value for all the money being spent. Growth is the priority to get the deficit down. It is important not to waste the stimulus money.

Good job the Bank of England has created an extra £450 billion of money to cut the cost  of  state debt. The Bank buys the state debt and the state owns the Bank.  We now need a plan for economic recovery to  cut  the  deficit  as this should be a one off for the lockdowns.

Project Fear never gives up over Brexit. If they are so  concerned about the UK car industry why have they been so quiet over the collapse of petrol  and diesel car sales this year? It  took place whilst we were still in the  single market  and  customs  union.

Talk today of review clauses in the EU Agreement in future years. We don’t want a bad agreement with never ending talks and the hope of improvement years later. We voted to leave, not for an Agreement. Take back control. Reject any  EU proposal  to keep us as a colony.

Instead of thinking up more complex rules for everyone government should spell out the risks of the virus and trust people to make more of  their own decisions. Help those who want protection .Let  others rescue the economy  and get on with their lives, judging safety themselves.

We need more than a few days of permitted contact over Christmas. We need a plan to protect the vulnerable who want help, improve our health care and restore our freedoms. We need to rescue many jobs and businesses on the edge of loss from lock down.

This week we need a bold plan for prosperity and growth. More tax rises and 600 pages of possible legal text from the EU would damage us more and hold us back. Let's cut taxes and invest in a great independent future.

You cannot tax your way into prosperity. Let’s have a positive economic plan for recovery next week based  on backing enterprise. Let people keep more of what they earn to spend as they wish. We need more confidence not punishment.

Past PMs usually back all things EU. The EU and its member states spent 0.42% of GDP last year on overseas aid compared with the U.K. at 0.7% . So why are they against us copying the EU on this issue? Why don’t they criticise the EU instead of the U.K.?

Well done the PM. Back your Home Secretary. Help her cut through to take control of our borders and battle crime. Why hasn’t the Home Office done more to stop people trafficking across the Channel as the Home  Secretary wishes?

The issue at the Home Office should be why did some officials resist controlling our borders and tackling the scourge of people trafficking across the Channel. The Home Secretary has rightly  been trying to enforce the law and to stop crime.

I read the Chancellor is planning a pay freeze for the public sector other than NHS. If he does so he must legislate to override the Independent MP Pay body that otherwise will  pay more to MPs at a time of restraint.

Before we all rip out our gas boilers we will want to know how the replacement is better and cheaper to run. Most people don’t have the large sum sitting in the bank to pay for this and don’t want the disruption of the work. How will government help?

The government experts give us bad news on CV 19 deaths every day but not deaths from flu and pneumonia which are down. How did they work  out  more days of lockdown if we meet families at Christmas?  Why is R still a range and not a firm figure based on all  these  tests?

Time to produce our own biomass to turn into electricity. Why are we still shipping wood to burn all the way across the Atlantic when we can grow our own?  It’s not good economics nor good for the environment.
I welcome the government’s plans for more tree planting. More woods will be good. Let’s grow more trees to meet our timber needs instead of all that importing with long sea voyages.

The SNP have only ever wanted to use devolution to destroy the union of the U.K. They have not used devolution powers to improve public services or the growth rate in Scotland. The SNP see the Scottish Parliament as a battering ram against the U.K.

Where are the Freeports ? The government should announce them, not just talk about them. We need them to be ready for January 1st when we leave the EU single market . They are another of the wins from a clean exit from the EU.

The  Treasury wants to tax electric car drivers for using the roads. There goes the biggest advantage the electric car enjoys. If they add a new road use tax to existing fuel taxes for diesel and petrol vehicles as well   the van and car driver will be unfairly overtaxed.

The EU is still calling for the U.K. to meet its demands. No deal is better than their deal. The U.K. must not surrender its fish, nor its sovereignty. We voted to leave, not for a bad Agreement. If the EU now wants a deal they should honour their promise of free trade.

BBC’S World This Weekend gives the EU and Ireland the chance again to put the case for UK surrender in the trade talks. No balance. No-one reminding them we voted to leave, not to give in and be under their laws and rules. More Project Fear nonsense.
Gave an interview on @Unlocked_UK_ setting out why we want Brexit done and how we can use our new freedoms as a self governing country no longer under single market controls.

The government’s medical and scientific advisers should apply their minds to how they can allow us to have a great  Christmas holiday. The nation needs something good to look forward to for its mental well being. Business needs a boost from seasonal sales.

The EU moves from threat to threat because the U.K. has not given in to their bullying. Time for the U.K. establishment to back our side for a change and call the EU out for saying  they will break their word and their Treaty.

Disappointing to hear from the talks the EU still wants the U.K. to be a colony. Good news that the U.K. is not making any concessions. We have to repeat we intend to leave the single market and customs union to be independent, in control of our own laws, money and fish.
Brexit voters did not vote for a deal on EU terms. We voted to leave. We want an independent country that owes the EU nothing and makes our own way in the world.

The EU single market has damaged our economy, crippling us with a huge trade deficit whilst we have a surplus with the rest of the world. They took our fish, cut our food production and even pushed us into importing electricity. Time to break free and do better.

The UK runs a large balance of trade deficit with the EU so a free trade agreement helps them more than us. Good of the UK to keep to the promise of a relationship based on a free trade deal. No need to make any compromises on laws, fish or ECJ powers. We want to be independent.
Good news we may soon get the vaccine the scientists wanted. Time for the government advisers to turn their minds to saving livelihoods and changing the current policy.

The Internal Market Bill does not break the law but changes U.K. law to help trade. Why does the House of Lords always take the E.U. line and seek to undermine  the U.K‘s negotiations? Why do they always want us to be governed by Brussels?

Today the UK government must tell Mr Barnier again we will become an independent country making our own laws, controlling our own fish and no longer under the European  Court. Why can’t the EU keep its  word  that our future relationship will  centre  on free trade?
Today we remember all those who died in war so we can live in freedom and peace. They suffered so much and sacrificed their lives.  We owe it to them to protect and use those liberties they defended.

When the facts change it’s time to change your opinion. The latest data on the virus is nowhere near the alarming graphs used to impose the lockdown. Time for  the government advisers to think again. Let’s find better ways to save livelihoods as well as lives.

Time to do more to get the UK back to work as safely as possible. Where are the government ideas and help to business to live with the virus whilst we await more effective cures? We want more levelling up, not more closing down.
Glad to see CV 19 cases fell in Wokingham last week. It looks as if new cases nationally peaked before the lockdown started. Also good news there have been  fewer flu deaths this year than usual.

I hope we do not need many furlough payments through to next March. We need to get much more of our economy working again long before then. Let’s concentrate on improving safety for people to do their jobs.

Glad to see the government advisers have scaled back their forecasts of CV19 deaths substantially. So why did they make such a mistake? They also need to clarify what they currently mean by a Covid death, where the patient had various serious health  problems.

I praise the brave work of NHS staff in saving lives from the virus. We do need to ask the management with record levels of staff and money why this summer the NHS was still so far behind on non virus treatment and surgery?

Good to hear the U.K. government is not selling us out on powers of the EU court, Law making, fish and borders. The EU needs to understand the U.K. intends to be an independent country if they want a Free Trade Agreement as they promised.

We need more persuasion and less law to tame the virus. People will respond to clear guidance of what can help slow the spread. We cannot frame  laws to cover all the different circumstances in people's social lives and jobs nor decide how everyone should live at home and work.

It is disappointing the government has not offered more improvements to its lock down measures to help sport, entertainment and  business. MPs and others  have offered plenty of ideas to ease the damage to economic and social life.

Glad to see others now question the forecasts of deaths and cases used by the advisers to demand lockdown. Still seeking the figures for NHS hospital bed capacity and to find out why they are not using the Nightingales for CV 19.

If government bans people from working and earning a living they need to compensate them. We will need our small businesses and the self employed to rebuild our economy after lockdown.  I called for a better deal for them in the Commons today to help them through the shutdown.

Why won’t the government advisers and NHS management give us believable forecasts rather than hugely wide and some wild illustrations of worst cases? Where are the accurate figures for NHS bed occupancy? How do they now define a CV 19 death?

Keep outdoor sporting facilities open. Let garden centres and specialist household supply shops trade. Government should help indoor businesses improve air extraction and social distancing  to allow them to stay open safely.

The proposed lock down will be damaging to livelihoods and business. The government should work with business to allow more to stay open. I hope the CBI drop their opposition to Brexit and  concentrate on the pandemic policy damage.
What is the exit strategy from national lock down?
If the case for lock down is worry about NHS capacity why is the forecast for hospital admissions a huge range including  fewer cases than the NHS managed earlier this year?
The BBC wrote to MPs promising impartial broadcasting. I have written back asking them to allow more informed alternatives to the global establishment views they usually peddle.
Doesn’t a national lock down merely delay rather than stop the virus? Let’s concentrate on cures and limiting transmission whilst allowing businesses to stay open.
Why doesn't the car industry speak out about the huge collapse in car sales that has occurred whilst we are still fully  in the customs union and single market? What is their remedy for this?

Time to legislate to make it more difficult for people smugglers to run their vile trade across the Channel, risking the lives of those they fleece. There must be no reward for breaking the law like this.
The EU imposes high tariffs on food imports to protect domestic producers. Should we do the same when we have left the single market, to encourage our own home industry?

Further disastrous slump in U.K. car output whilst still in the EU single market. The threat to U.K. car manufacture was always the policy of stopping diesel and petrol Vehicles, and now anti virus policies, not Brexit.
The government must do more to stop the tragic loss of life in the Channel. Root out the traffickers and make clear we only welcome economic migrants who come by legal routes.

The CBI has a long record of recommending damaging EU economic policies to the U.K, starting with the Exchange Rate Mechanism which caused a deep recession and continuing with support for policies causing the banking crash. Why should we trust their advice on Brexit?
Measures to control the spread of the virus need widespread public support. The Welsh measures do not pass that test as they do too much economic damage.

More scaremongering about tariffs. Once we leave the EU’s control we decide whether to impose tariffs on imports  and our government  pockets  the money if we do. The EU makes us pay high tariffs on non EU food and they take the money. Once out we will be better off on tariffs.

If the government's scientific  advisers now say we have to learn to live with the virus as it is unlikely any  vaccine will banish it fully, why do they still want lock downs? Time to take sensible precautions allowing  people to make  judgements about how to protect themselves.

Glad to see the EU now says it wants a Free Trade Agreement. No need for the UK to give any ground on other matters. We must take full control of our fish, our laws and our borders, and end the rule of the European Court.
To tackle poverty we need a better approach to living with and working with  the virus as well as the higher Universal Credit.
I am calling again for the government to do more to help make restaurants, cafes, pubs and meeting rooms safer by better air extraction so more can get back to work.

The government must not give any ground in seeking a so called deal. No deal is much better than the deals the EU has in mind. They want us back under their single market  control which has done much damage to our industry, fishing and farming over the years.
We need greater clarity on how to get a city or county out of the higher tiers of control. People need hope these controls will end.
If the government stops business trading and people working it needs to pay them for the loss of income. I look forward to a better package from the Chancellor.
We voted to leave the  single market and customs union. The government must  not negotiate us back into  these damaging arrangements.
Before wasting time on more talks with the EU the EU should confirm we will control our fish, make our own laws and control our own borders and they have dropped their  demands in these areas.
So the EU now wants to talk. No point unless they drop their demands to carry on making our laws, taking our fish and putting us under the control of their court.

The Netherlands tells us to give in to the EU to help their exports to us. Let’s instead grow more of our own food and  trade more with rest of the  world who do not want to stop us being independent as a requirement  to  trade.

Bishops in the Lords side with the EU against the majority wish for the U.K. to be independent. Is that the best they can use their privileged position for when government is fighting the damage the pandemic does to lives and livelihoods?

UK farmers should be planning and investing  for a big increase in home demand for their food. I see plenty of packs in the shops now have the U.K. flag on. No-one puts the EU flag on the imports. Why is that?

Good to see Michael Gove stressing the need for the U.K. to be free of the ECJ, EU laws, control of our fish and the rest. Our trade has grown faster with the rest of the world under WTO rules than with the EU in the single market. Time to just leave. No more talks.
Why did the EU waste the last year instead of talking free trade? Why do they now want to talk? No point if they still want to rule us and take our fish. We voted to be self governing.

The EU makes us impose tariffs on  food from the rest of the world so they clearly believe in them . They now seem to be in panic that we will put tariffs on food from  the EU as we come to trade with them on WTO terms. So why didn't they keep their word on a Free Trade deal?
The U.K. will prosper more with no deal than with a bad deal.
Well said Prime Minister. We should now leave without giving away our laws and our fish. He is right the EU has not negotiated seriously, so it is best to leave and trade under World trade  rules.
The U.K. should withdraw any offer  of a 3 year further transition for fish. Offer the EU no quota for next year so we can rebuild our fish stocks and expand our own industry.
Mrs Merkel still doesn’t get it. The U.K. voted to be a fully independent state. Let’s get on with it. The EU still wants control over us as if we had not left.
The EU have not negotiated in good faith. Time to end the talks as promised.

Circuit breakers stop the flow, but you get full power back as soon as you cancel them. Not a good model for controlling the virus. We need to work away at better treatments and better infection control whilst allowing people to work.
No sign of the EU offering the Free Trade Agreement they baked into the Political declaration. No sign of good faith from their negotiators.
Before imposing a new lock down the government must explain how it will be lifted and how that stops the virus after lock down.
Let us assume there is no early solve all vaccine. We need to allow people to carry on working  as safely as possible. We cannot go back in to national lock down without grave economic damage.
Glad to get confirmed yesterday the NHS is using an anti viral as well as a steroid to help treat some CV 19 patients, and is testing the other drug Mr Trump used. We need more and better treatments.

The U.K. should not surrender our fish or our law making powers. Leave the  talks as promised if the EU still doesn’t agree a Free Trade Agreement. We trade well with the USA without an Agreement so FTAs are not essential.
If businesses are closed by anti virus policies the Treasury must compensate them. We want hospitality and entertainment businesses to re open as soon as they are allowed to.
Why doesn’t the NHS use the Nightingale hospitals for CV 19 and keep more of the other hospitals virus free for all the  other treatments people need?
The government must show  any new restrictions will stop the spread of the virus and carry Parliament and the public with it. It needs buy in to work.
Time for government to send an even clearer law to the courts to tackle people smuggling. The courts keep finding against the Home Secretary as she takes on the illegal migration business.
I spoke yesterday at the CPS fringe meeting at the Conservative conference urging lower tax rates and fewer taxes as the way to speed recovery and boost jobs.
No need to give fish away to EU to get a trade deal. Time to expand our fishing fleet and look after our fishing grounds better.
Time to get on with leaving the EU. They still do not want to honour their promise that they will accept our independence.

The UK left the EU to restore our sovereignty, and put a clear sovereignty clause in the Withdrawal Act. We now need to exercise that sovereignty if the EU shows more bad faith over a Free Trade Agreement.
The UK left the EU to shake off the control of the European Court of Justice. The UK does not agree with the EU's interpretation of the Withdrawal Agreement. The ECJ cannot settle that difference.
No need to offer our fish to secure a Free Trade Agreement with the EU. They had another three years to take our fish since the vote already.
I read the Chancellor wants to rescue the economy, so when will he improve his job scheme so it helps save more jobs?
Glad to read the government wants the NHS to have some CV 19 isolation hospitals and some CV 19 free hospitals for other serious conditions. Last time non CV 19 suffered too much.
Why has the Bank stopped offering a good monetary stimulus when the economy  is still well below February levels?
Why is the  Treasury talking tax rises when the  economy  needs a boost after the hit to incomes and demand from the CV 19 measures?
The Chancellor needs to improve his offer to the sectors that are being hit again by the tougher lock downs and closures
The part time working support needs to be set at levels to discourage redundancies instead.
The Chancellor needs to improve his scheme to save jobs. Businesses that are closed by law to stop the virus need compensation. Many of their  jobs will be needed when the law is relaxed.
When will the government‘s scientific advisers tell us about the accuracy of the tests and how many false positives they think there are?
Time for the Treasury to tell us how they will compensate businesses prevented from trading by the new six months controls.

Instead of broadcasting to the nation  the government advisers should share more of the detail and submit themselves to Parliamentary  style questioning to tease out the problems with their data and conclusions.

The government advisers today need to tell us how they are going to stop false test results distorting the figures. How are they going to calculate an accurate R Number? Data needs improving to improve decisions.
Time to protect the Care homes as the pandemic rears up again. We must learn how to keep more people safe and economic  activity going at the same time.
I have written to Matt Hancock asking for news on treatments for CV 19, where they are running trials of various possibilities.
The UK under past PMs apart from Mrs Thatcher gave in to the EU all the time. The public got fed up with a rotten deal and voted out.
Only Margaret Thatcher of our past PM s refused to make concessions and got a better  deal out of the EU on the money.
The government needs to provide more home tests for CV 19 and needs to buy in more laboratory capacity to process them.
Trade deals are nice to have but not essential. We didn't  have a trade deal with the USA when in the EU. Getting back full control of our laws, our money and  our borders is essential.
Many countries want a trade deal with the U.K. They want  to negotiate with a country in full control of its own laws and trade policy. That’s the point of today’s legislation.
Our international standing rests on successfully taking control of our laws, our trade policy and our borders. Today’s Bill helps do that.
I have asked for more CV 19 tests locally. Public Health England needs more capacity.
Good to see government lawyers confirming Parliament's right to legislate on our single market and customs Union.

The EU is now saying they will continue the trade talks with the UK because they think the PM is bluffing over the new legislation. Not a good start to say he is not telling the truth about the UK's plans.
The EU is still trying to treat the UK as a colony. We left so EU law and their court no longer rules us. Parliament now decides on UK law and trade policy.

We need a new planning system which promotes levelling up. The government’s proposals out for consultation need revision so more of the investment in new homes can go where people are keen to see more building  and jobs.
The latest GDP figures show health output is still well down on February levels. We do need to restore  all the non pandemic services soon.
I asked the government yesterday to get Ofqual and the Examining Boards to set out all the details for next year’s A level, GCSE and vocational exams.

Leaving the EU was a vote to take back control. The EU Withdrawal Act expressly set out a national sovereignty clause to ensure we can protect our single market and customs union. The government is implementing that law.
If the EU does still want a Free Trade Agreement with the U.K. as they stated in the Political Declaration they need to move on from trying to take more of our fish and keeping us under  their laws.

The EU refuses to implement the two main points of the Withdrawal Agreement, a free trade agreement and U.K. sovereignty. Why doesn’t the U.K. media call them out for this and interview them about this refusal to honour their promises?
No Deal with the EU is a much better outcome than what the EU is proposing. Time For the UK to move on from talks going nowhere.
The U.K. does need to legislate to change the EU Withdrawal Agreement if the EU continues to refuse to negotiate a Free Trade Agreement in good faith.
The EU needs to grasp we have voted three times to leave the single market and customs Union. The only thing to settle is do they want tariffs on their exports to us or a free trade agreement?
The UK is right to refuse to make concessions in the EU talks. No deal is better than a bad deal. Our right to self government must not be compromised.

This is a period of rapid change in the way we live, work and spend.  The government needs to offer more  help to the small businesses, to  more people setting up businesses and working for themselves.  They can adapt fastest .  Don't up their taxes  when we need them most.
Strong support for the idea that we need tax cuts to boost recovery, not tax rises to sandbag it. The way to get the deficit down is to get jobs and incomes up.
We control the entry of goods into the UK so there is no need to create delays and traffic jams at ports next year.
Tax rises now would hit returning confidence and damage recovery. It could increase not lower the deficit.
The big increase in housing activity shows tax cuts work. Lower Stamp duties bringing back jobs in the homes market. Will bring in more tax revenue.
The Treasury's hunt for savings should begin by ending payments to the EU from the end of the year.

Today Parliament needs to send a strong message that the UK intends to take back control of our fishing grounds. We need a policy that builds a bigger industry at home and is kinder on the environment.
Glad to see strong reaction against the idea of tax rises . That's the last thing we want. We need to get the deficit down by getting economic growth up.
The government needs to confirm that GCSE and A level exams will go ahead next year with fair arrangements  for pupils announced  well in advance.

We need a new plan for the railways now the state is running them and the taxpayer is paying the huge bill. Will there be flexible season  tickets for those part working at home? Is a high priced rush hour still sensible?
I do not mind a government U turn if they were going to do the wrong thing.
You cannot tax your way to faster growth and more prosperity. We need policies to promote more jobs and activity to get the deficit down.
Just heard the Radio 4 take on UK/EU trade talks. They only gave us the EU analysis. They should also let us state the  case for all the wins once we leave. Let's move on from  Project Fear.

Ed Davey's party is called Liberal and  Democrats. Which are they going to do first? They have  spent the last five years backing more government control over our lives and trying to undermine the democratic results of the referendum and the last European Parliament election.
Those who tell others not to work from home should first make sure they are in the office five days a week. What matters is getting the work done well.
By all means discuss the bad with the good in our history, but let's celebrate the many things we can be proud of. The UK has been a great champion of freedom and democracy.
Time for a new business plan for the railways. Taxpayers must not be asked to pick up the huge losses the railways make without thinking through what services we now need.
The BBC decision to ban two of our favourite songs will strengthen the movement to decriminalise the licence fee. More people want reform of the BBC tax.
Typical of the BBC to refuse to sing Britons never never never shall be slaves. They do not even agree with the rest of us that we can unite in a song condemning slavery and tyranny.
Glad the schools are opening up for all. School leaders can decide how best to organise their own schools to ensure all get a good education.
Time to harness both existing government and university laboratories to the common cause of public health
The best way to get the deficit down is tax cuts that boost growth and boost tax revenues.

Good to read the Treasury is querying the need for an expensive new headquarters for the new body replacing Public Health England. There's no shortage of better value office space around including empty space already  in the public sector.

The government advisers set out three different ways of estimating R, and take a final figure as a compromise from all three . Why not perfect the best way of measuring the spread more accurately? Why not use growth in cases rather than R?

We need better figures for the spread of the virus and for the death rate from it before more lock downs. The latest R figure at 0.9 to 1.1 is too wide and too vague. The scientific advisers admit that R "cannot be measured directly so there is always uncertainty".
Prosperity not austerity should be the policy. Get the deficit down by growing the economy.
Glad to see the wrong figures used during the lock down are being adjusted. Must base any local lock downs and other virus measures on good data, not on inflated numbers.
Big increase in government debt as expected. This is an affordable one off. Now need to get the economy back to work fully to bring the deficit down.
There is no magic money tree. The government needs to set out a new plan for the now nationalised railway to cut the huge losses.
The government needs to encourage a faster recovery so it can roll back public spending and bring the deficit down. It also needs to get the public sector back to work.
I urge the government to re open the question of how many places there can be for medical students at University. Now more students have the high grades needed there is a shortage of places.

I have written to the Education Secretary asking how he will re establish confidence in grades and qualifications next year. How will he be fair to the class of 2021, when they need university places?

Ofqual should tell students how they can appeal where they think their A level grade is too low. Where are their 11 Communications officers and the Chairman when  we all want to hear what they are doing?
Any A level student unhappy about their grade should appeal or sit the exam. Glad schools can help students provide evidence needed to get an upgrade where there is a good case.
Best to holiday in the UK given the uncertainties about the spread of the virus abroad
Good news that fewer people now  with the virus in  the UK need hospital treatment, and good news that there are now some proven treatments to cut the death rate and speed recovery  from CV 19.

The media mislead when they give the sad news that the USA and Brazil have the worst death experience from the virus. If you take deaths per million from the virus to allow for different sized populations then the worst three are Belgium, Peru and Spain.
Congratulations to all students who have done well in their A levels. Let's hope it let's you all get into the courses and Colleges you want to join.

Glad to see fewer English deaths from virus in revised figures. Belgium still sadly has most deaths per million followed by Peru and Spain. Country death numbers unadjusted for population are useless figures.
The last thing we need now is higher taxes. All policies must help promote economic recovery. The railways need a better plan to win back passengers.
Levelling up needs great education for all. Time to get the schools back with a full timetable in September.
The UK needs to legislate to make it more difficult for the people traffickers and to make clear our intention to say No to illegal migration from safe countries.

Time for the government to produce more accurate death figures for CV 19 in England. First change should be to use the Scottish 28 day cut off period between positive  CV test and death. Second is to distinguish death with from death because of CV 19.
Time to legislate for a UK asylum system which is fair and which gives the courts and enforcement agencies the powers to stop people trafficking and illegal entry more easily.
I am asking Matt Hancock what progress there has been with the trials of existing medicines to treat CV 19. It would be good to tame the virus more.
A new planning system should support levelling up, helping more new private investment in homes to go to places needing growth and a boost to incomes.
The government needs to legislate for a better asylum system with a crackdown on people smuggling and criminal activity.
Why doesn't the government use the same counting system for CV 19 deaths in England as Scotland? Why overstate the English numbers?
Good to see Home Secretary demanding action to stop these dangerous Channel crossings. We must tackle the people traffickers and prevent this illegality.
I am asking the Health Secretary what progress there is with clinical trials of more existing drugs that might help treat the virus.
Good idea to cut down the size and complexity of local plans. They should be map based. Also need to reflect local opinion on pace and style of development.
Time for government to review all contingency and stand by contracts to reduce spending now virus under better control. Need to start tackling the borrowing level.
Welcome recovery in new car sales, but this year official hostility to diesel and petrol vehicles and high VED on new cars will depress this industry.
No deal is better than a bad deal. UK right to hold out for an FTA whilst taking full control of our laws, borders and fish.
Councils need to make it easier to drive to shopping centres and to park given the advice on public transport. We want more people to use the shops otherwise more will shut permanently.
Silly opposition games on Trade Bill. There is no need to legislate to let Parliament scrutinise future trade deals. Parliament has that power anyway and will use it.
The EU recovery and resilience plan takes time to build up. They suggest no spend this year, and maybe 60bn euros next year with more in later years to get up to the 560bn total.
The EU has agreed common financing with transfers to poorer countries. Its a big step towards full political union.
Parliament had no chance to vote down  trade deals we did not like when the EU did them for us.
Tomorrow we debate trade yet again. Why does the opposition think it is crucial to have a FTA with the EU and crucial not to have one with the USA? Both can be helpful but neither at any price.
Safe working is what we need. Quick responses to virus outbreaks based on good data are now essential.

The Prime Minister wants more life to return to our cities. The government scientists are worried that will boost the virus again. Business has difficult choices to make to adapt to save livelihoods as well as lives.
City centres are still suffering. Government needs to find safe ways of getting them going again.
The UK needs to boost telecoms research and manufacture at home as the government moves to reduce Chinese influence.
Why the delay on new border arrangements? Let's have them ready for 1 January 2020.I'm sure the civil service could deliver in the next six months.
Let's get on with new freeports. They need plenty of freedoms and low taxes to maximise new jobs and power prosperity.
Time to accelerate a digital working revolution in the public sector. Empower people at home as well as in the office to work smarter, raising quality and productivity.
I'm asking the Treasury to make clear if you get qualifying energy saving work done now you will get the financial help. People are putting off work until they see the details of the scheme.
@AndrewRosindell Given the bans and problems with overseas travel destinations it's a good time to book a holiday in the UK where there are some great places to visit.
Bad news tonight from retailers with big job losses. Government and councils need to offer a better deal on business rates, car parks and access to help shops.
Important to save and create many jobs. Chancellor's package helpful. More will be needed.
Important the government today does all it can to promote recovery and save jobs. Right to concentrate on young people and lower paid jobs where there have  been more job losses.
I hope all the hospitality businesses and shops who opened  have found it worthwhile. Thanks to them for adapting to  help  keep people safe.
Great disappointment last night that government refused to think again about IR 35.We need all the self employed we can get to  help power the recovery.
Good to see PM ruling out austerity. Let's have tax cuts for recovery.
Well done David Frost. He has repeated a clear UK position. We are leaving the single market as we leave the EU as both Leave and Renain said we would. No more rule from the European Court.

Glad Mrs Merkel has at last grasped the UK wishes to be an independent country in charge of our own laws, borders, money and fish. She warns there will be consequences. Yes we will be free and better off.
Need to make town centres easier to get to and more welcoming. The High Street needs help to recover.
There must be no second lock down. Let's make test and trace work to control the virus and get more back to work and school
We need planning which helps the High Streets recover by allowing changes of use. We need to get properties occupied, removing empty frontage.
We need to help the High Streets recover. The government should allow easy change of use to get properties occupied and serving the community
Great to hear Australia is  very keen on doing a free trade deal with us. Global UK has plenty of opportunity ahead.
Time to roll out policies for our full exit from the EU. Let's aim to produce more of  our own food, energy and technology. Let's have a trade and security policy that helps us.
Now overseas aid will reflect our foreign policy we should lead with free trade. That's the best way to help countries out of poverty. We should invest in good projects to boost their economies.
Now the government is uniting overseas aid with our foreign policy we should rethink who we give aid to and how to ensure it achieves more, especially in the relief of poverty.
Glad government reaffirmed strong position on fish, borders  and laws. No need to delay introduction of new trade system from January 1,2020.Tell HMRC to get ready.
Yesterday I raised the issue of why the government is accepting the EU requirement that we should import more electricity from the continent. We want more domestic supply with more jobs at home.

From January 1 next year we want proper border controls on all our trade as we have today on non EU trade. Use trusted  trader schemes to avoid delays at the ports but insist on our standards and tariffs applying fairly to all. Payments  and checks can happen away from  ports.
Great news latest tests show new infections well down. Time to get more safe working up and running
Glad there will be no more brexit delays. Must have border controls to stop people traffickers and illegal food imports that do not meet our standards.
Plenty of support for statues being determined by democratic debate and votes. A Labour mayor kept the Bristol statue when he could have found a legal way to remove it.

A clean brexit this year will help us recover from the pandemic. Let's use the freedoms to rebuild our fishing and farming for more home food supply for starters. Cut the food miles and create jobs here.
The scientists advising the government chose the date for lock down. Why has one of them now said that was wrong?

I have always hated the brutality of the occupying armies of the roman empire and the slavery they brought. It does not make me want to tear down the statues of the men who did this to our ancestors. They are there to remind us of their brutality.
The government needs to adopt the WHO one metre rule on social distancing so more schools and the hospitality industry can get to work again. 2 metres adds little extra protection.
Let's have higher standards of animal welfare when we leave the EU at the end of this year. The EU held us back when improving conditions for farm animals.
Remain politicians are out to prevent a US trade deal and keep us in the single market. Its nonsense that we have to have a free trade agreement for the EU but not for the USA.
When will government publish accurate figures for cv 19 tranmission based on sample testing over time? We need good figures to be able to press on with end of lock down.
At a Conservative meeting tonight on zoom strong local pressure to scrap IR 35,and help small business more.

The government needs to take on board the anger about IAG's wish to sack so many BA employees and worsen terms of employment for the rest. This unites many MPs of all parties who want the government to take some action to help the staff of the airline.
As we take control of our fishing grounds we need to land more of our fish in the U.K. and sell it to U.K. consumers. Let’s have more fresh fish counters in supermarkets, not fewer.
More needs to be done to get people back to work and to save more jobs. We need an early budget to boost business. We need to make it easier for small business and the self employed.

The plundering of our fish stocks was one of the worst features of our EU membership. It combined large environmental damage with large economic loss for the U.K. This must end in December. We want a fishing 
policy that is kinder to our fish and our fishing industry.

There is no need to talk about our fish this week. The U.K. is becoming  an independent coastal state. Our fish must not be given away again. Rebuilding our fish stocks and landing more of what we do catch in the U.K. is one of the big wins from Brexit.

The EU economic package to respond to the damage done by lock downs includes proposals for a 66% tax hike in EU tax demands on member states. Good job we are leaving completely in December. The last thing we need now are new taxes. We need to encourage business and consumers.

Lockdown led to a welcome downturn in virus cases going to hospital and in deaths. Why hasn’t it led to much lower case levels by now? How is the virus spreading when most people are staying at home or observing social distancing?
The test and trace rules use in one part a 1 metre test for close contact, the WHO measure. Is the UK advice on social distancing changing? Other countries use shorter distances than 2 metres.
What is the advice on train travel? What if someone with CV19 travels before knowing. Do fellow travellers in the carriage  need to self isolate?
We need to save lives and livelihoods. Too many incomes have been lost or damaged by lock down so we need to move on whilst keeping the pressure on to cut the spread of the pandemic.
We need to find safe ways of working for more people. We need to fight mass unemployment as well as the virus.
Government needs to help big business get back to work and earn more from customers. We dont want taxpayer stakes in loss making businesses with too little turnover.
The garden centres were very busy today showing people do want more businesses working with social distancing.
Need to take urgent action to combat mass unemployment. Scrap IR35, make it easier to take on a first employee and lift the VAT threshold to  help the self employed and small business.
The Opposition should stop hounding Dominic Cummings. How would they have ensured children were looked after if both parents became seriously ill?
The only way to get government borrowing down is to get more people back to work. If the bans on working go on for too long more of  the serious damage will become permanent.
The government needs to do more to stop people trafficking. Protect our borders please.
Time to clamp down on the people traffickers.
Countries do  not pay to trade under Free Trade Agreements. The UK does not have to pay the EU for a deal - not in money, not in in fish nor by sacrificing some of our freedoms.
If we let unemployment rise more and see companies start to sack furloughed  workers it will become difficult to secure a strong recovery any time soon
Tragic but predictable surge in unemployment, with more to come. We need to get more people back to work safely as quickly as possible.
What is the UK’s latest medical and scientific advice on the use of Vitamin D against the virus? Where have they got to with the trials of various existing medicines as treatments?
How are the drug trials for treating CV 19 going? Some experts think there are existing drugs that help fight the disease.
We need to give children an education in a safe way. The government is right to ask schools to come up with plans. It will also take scientific and medical advice before acting.
The EU finding against us in their court just confirms the need to leave with no residual EU power over us.
There's momentum for tax cuts to help the recovery from the big fall in output and incomes this spring. There's no support amongst Conservative MPs for tax rises.
Time to cut taxes to promote recovery. Cut Stamp Duty and Vehicle Excise Duty to boost the homes and car markets.
Councils and government need to do more to make it easier to get to work by car whilst public transport is restricted. Free up junctions and provide more free parking.
The government needs to help people get to work safely by opening up new car parks and helping councils offer free parking

Tomorrow we need action to get more people back to work. Open the garden centres, let the dentists practice,  encourage businesses that produce social distancing and more homeworking models.We have to earn a living and fight the virus.

Tomorrow we need action to get more people back to work. Open the garden centres, let the dentists practice,  encourage businesses that produce social distancing and more homeworking models.We have to earn a living and fight the virus.
Furlough needs to carry on all the time businesses cannot trade. Need to flex to allow part time furlough for employees who can work for some of the time to bridge back to work.
We remember the sacrifice of many in the war and the joy felt when freedom was won. We owe it to them to cherish freedom  and use it well.
Continuing good news on decline of Covid 19 patients in hospital. Plenty of NHS capacity.
We need to get more people back to work safely. Time to open the garden centres and to let people go fishing
The elderly should not be kept under house arrest against their will. Anyone who needs and wants  to stay home to stay safe should be helped to do so.
The right to work should not depend on a macabre lottery where you have to prove you survived the virus.
Why is the Spanish company that owns BA threatening UK workers with redundancy but not the same for the Spanish Airlines it owns? It should furlough not sack and work for recovery.
Why does the experts  keep changing the graphs and numbers? To manage you need consistent accurate figures.
Time to come out with a back to work plan with more homeworking, staggered shifts and social distancing.
Why doesn't the government produce population adjusted figures for deaths on a consistent basis if it wants international comparisons?
The UK death numbers are worrying but are often not comparable with other countries. They need to be adjusted for population size and for different ways of recording deaths.
Directors of small companies they work in still not being helped by Treasury. Time to think again as we will need them for the recovery.
Glad government is going to help care homes more. Plenty of vulnerable people who need best levels of protection.
Parliament tomorrow must say we need to save jobs as well as lives. We need more people in work to help pay for the NHS.
Good to see government looking at ways for people to get back to work with employee protection. Needs to do more to protect care homes where too many die of CV 19
Glad Dominic Cummings listens to Sage discussions. Government needs an intelligent adviser to assess and use the various scientific advice on offer.
Great news that NHS has plenty of bed capacity and is coping well. First key objective met so far.
Glad the government is now processing more UK offers of PPE. We need more made in Britain.
The EU trying to buy PPE as well as national health systems does not add any PPE production. We need more supply not more buyers.
Good to know more UK manufacturers want to make PPE for NHS. Let's hope there can be contracts for them to produce good quality clothing.
We need to learn to live with the virus, reducing risks for all. Parliament is having a go with its new model this week. More remote working and more use of technology is  a big part of the answer.
Glad Parliament will meet again. We need to underline some of the questions and proposals we have been putting to Ministers in emails and conversations in recent weeks with PQs.
Can we have a plan for the NHS  to gradually resume non emergency  work as virus cases decline?
Open the garden centres with social distancing. Let's start to get people back to work in  ways adapted to reduce virus risks.
The government needs to rell us how more of the non virus work of the NHS will be done as we pass peak virus cases in hospital.
Glad government confirmed no need to delay Brexit. They can carry on talking on video links.
It's time to think through how we can adapt work to reduce virus risk so we can get the economy working again. Technology can be a big help. People need their incomes back.

Time to improve financial and shopping help for the  medially vulnerable and elderly who need to avoid social contact . Time to start to get more people back to work with suitable precautions and more home working. We need to save more jobs and businesses now.

It's good news there are signs of new hospital cases levelling off when there is still plenty of NHS bed capacity for the crisis. The NHS has made a big effort to expand medical teams and provide more beds for the epidemic.
Good to see some progress with furlough scheme, but it needs to go faster to avoid yet more job losses. Companies need cash now to help pay the wages where they cannot work.
Good to hear some hope of reaching a peak soon in virus cases. Need to be thinking about next phase to protect the vulnerable and get more back to work.
Self employed people and small businesses prevented from working need cash help now. The Treasury needs to speed up the administration of the schemes.
We need a recovery plan for the economy, which means getting people back to work as soon as possible.
Best wishes to the PM for a speedy recovery
Good to see hospital admissions for corona virus starting to level off in London. Let's hope that's the start of a better trend.
Well done to all those who have expanded NHS bed capacity to handle virus cases, and to all those medics who are volunteering to help the NHS during the epidemic.
Furlough  scheme still not open for claims and not making payments. In order to save jobs many companies need cash now.

The Treasury failure to put in generous job and business saving schemes rapidly means there will now be a large and worrying  increase in unemployment. Businesses banned from trading have to cut costs quickly.
Government must offer a better package to the self employed and include more them in their schemes. I am pressing the Chancellor to offer immediate cash to those who are not allowed to work.
The government needs to tell us how much flatter the curve they talk of needs to be. We all want to minimise deaths and help the NHS through, so what does that take?
I want to say a big thank you to all the self employed. They are there for us come rain come shine. They need our support now. They provide great choice and service.

MPs get to know where the  problems are with the shut downs and public service strains thanks to high volumes of issues and advice coming to us from  our constituents. Parliament needs to be more involved in shaping solutions to these problems.

Parliament needs to adapt its working methods and hold the government to account during the crisis. The recess is too long. Why not have a daily Ministerial update with MPs cross examining the duty Cabinet Minister remotely, as with the daily government press briefings?
I want to say a big thank you to all the self employed. They are there for us come rain come shine. They need our support now. They provide great choice and service.
Increasing national insurance for the self employed is a bad idea. We need them to provide huge choice of goods and services flexibly and at keen prices. Let's not tax work and effort more.
Told the government they must speed up the furlough scheme and start payments, otherwise unemployment will rocket.
I put my proposals for the self employed to the Cabinet Office today to follow up the submission to the Chancellor. Told them it is urgent. We need a quicker and more generous scheme
I will ask the Treasury today to speed up help for the self employed. June is a long way away if you have no income because you have been told to suspend your business.

Now we have seen all the schemes to keep people and companies going during the closures we can welcome what is being done. There will still however be increases in unemployment and drops in income which is bad news. The government cannot do too much.
The self employed need the money sooner. We will need them and their skills as soon as we can live normally again
The commercial banks need to help more companies through the cash flow problems. Companies need the money now to  keep businesses ready to go to work again.
Let's hope the Chancellor delivers for the self employed tomorrow. He also needs to speed up work on the subsidy plan to keep employees in jobs so companies can get the money.
People need more than food and medicines. I'm asking  for more guidance about repairs/maintenance/replacements at home when things go wrong.

The Chancellor needs to speed up his work on helping the self employed. The Revenue know who they are and their bank accounts. They should send them some money for a change. Base it on last year's  monthly turnover. Let people have top up to 80% of previous income.
Now the government has decided to close down  a large sector of the economy it needs to do more to build up the essential services we need to get through the next few weeks
Still work to be done to offset some of the hit to the economy. We need a big effort of volunteers and businesses to help and deliver to those self isolating
See https://t.co/XWUitdW203 for letter to constituents with latest government help and advice for handling the virus crisis. Tackles issues of jobs, pay, taxes, self employment, food supply etc
Glad to see the scheme to pay wages. This should save many jobs. Still need something better for the self employed.
Bank of England did all it could yesterday to supply money to the system. Now the commercial banks need to help their customers get through this shut down.
Glad government is not going to delay our exit from EU. Talks can take place on the Internet and conference calls. Do not increase uncertainty and cost with more delay.
Good to hear talks under way to agree help for businesses who keep staff on. Important not to have mass redundancies now.
It took ten years of hard work to create many jobs and record employment. Don't throw it away by allowing big redundancies when we hope the businesses will be needed again soon.
The government needs to head off many redundancies by offering support to businesses hit by virus closures. Keep the workforces together for an early recovery.

The budget forecasts from the Treasury and OBR were absurd. The virus effects will overwhelm them this month and were visible on Budget day. We need new forecasts based on the realities so we can adjust policy to more realistic figures. We need to battle the sharp downturn.
Time for a big package to help the self employed and all those businesses who have just lost most of their turnover. They need more than loans. They need tax holidays and help with payroll costs.
The government should work up a plan to help business keep people in work where their business has a large temporary drop in revenue from the virus
General support for the government's approach to slowing the spread of the virus. No need to panic buy, the supermarkets are doing a good job with supplies.

The European Bank chief upset markets by saying it was not their job to let Italy borrow as cheaply as Germany. Problem is they share a currency and Italy needs more money to  get it through the epidemic
The ECB called today for a fiscal response from Germany and Euro land to offset some of the virus effects. Are the Euro members listening?
The crash in the oil price takes more pressure off inflation. It reinforces the need for a big budget boost for business and consumers.
Time for the government to get behind small business and enterprise. Scrap IR35, keep Enterprise Allowance and cut business rares. Levelling up needs more entrepreneurs,not the politics of jealousy.
The government should not just delay some tax for small business but cancel it whilst revenues are down owing to the virus. Give them a break from business rates.
